Futures trading, characterized by high leverage and high returns, has attracted the attention of countless investors. To start Futures trading, the first step is to choose the right exchange to embark on your Futures trading journey. MEXC offers advantages, including the lowest fee rates in the industry, excellent trading depth, high security and stability, flexible trading rules, and industry-leading liquidity, making it the ideal choice for users engaging in Futures trading.



## 1. The Lowest Trading Fees in the Market
You can trade Futures on MEXC as either a Maker or a Taker.

Maker: A Maker places orders with a specified price and quantity, waiting for other users to match them. Maker orders add liquidity to the market.

Taker: A Taker actively matches existing limit or market orders for direct execution. Taker orders consume liquidity from the market.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20250205113652632siPe1Bqk4qHaGv.png]
MEXC offers the lowest fee rates in the market. In MEXC's perpetual Futures trading, the Maker fee rate is 0%, while the Taker fee rate is 0.02%. Additionally, you can deposit MX into your Futures account to offset Taker fees, enjoying an additional 20% fee discount. For more detailed information about MEXC's fee rates, you can refer toMEXC Related Fees.

It is worth mentioning that MEXC also offers the lowest fee rates for spot trading in the market. In spot trading, the Maker fee rate is 0%, while the Taker fee rate is 0.05%. You can check the latest fee rates on the following page:https://www.mexc.com/fee. Fee rates may vary by country or region. Please refer to the rates displayed on the fee rates page.



## 2. Excellent Trading Depth
Since its establishment, MEXC has excelled in discovering and listing high-quality projects, earning widespread acclaim from users. With years of industry experience and a solid reputation, MEXC has accumulated over 30 million users, becoming the first choice for both new and seasoned traders. Its business spans more than 170 countries and regions worldwide. MEXC Futures' vast user base ensures excellent market depth, with a balanced order book and transparent pricing. According to MEXC's Futures trading data at the time of writing, the trading volume in the past 24 hours exceeded $41.09 billion. This ensures that users can trade smoothly even in extreme market conditions, avoiding unexpected liquidations. (Note: Data as of November 12, 2024.)


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20241114112510506IwFMrmTOjSwc7U.png]
In addition, MEXC Futures features a rich variety of cryptocurrency types, including USDT-M perpetual Futures, Metaverse, Layer2, NFT, Meme, DeFi, and many more. Furthermore, MEXC's ability to discover high-quality projects and the continuously add new cryptocurrency options allow users to have the best trading experience.



## 3. High Security And Stability
MEXC's trading system features a multi-layer and multi-cluster architecture, powered by a high-performance trading engine developed by experts with specialized banking technology knowledge. It can process up to 1.4 million transactions per second, delivering breakthrough efficiency and performance.

Additionally, MEXC is the most secure trading platform. Users benefit from various security measures, includingidentity verification,two-factor authentication, andanti-phishing codes. Our servers are also independently hosted in multiple countries to ensure the security and integrity of user data.



## 4. Flexible Trading Rules
MEXC's Futures trading rules are highly flexible, with leverage adjustable from 1x to 400x. USDT-M perpetual Futures support a maximum leverage of 400x, while Coin-M perpetual Futures support up to 200x leverage. When trading Futures on MEXC, you can choose from limit orders, market orders, trigger orders, trailing-stop orders, post-only orders, andmore.

In terms of the margin system, users have the flexibility to choose between the cross margin and isolated margin modes. For the differences between cross margin and isolated margin modes, you can refer toMEXC Futures Trading Modes. Additionally, MEXC also supports the hedge mode, allowing users to hold both long and short positions for a single contract, with leverage set independently for each direction. When holding positions in hedge mode, the positions need to occupy the corresponding margin according to the risk limit level.



## 5. Industry-Leading Liquidity
MEXC offers industry-leading liquidity, with deep order books, frequent and large buy/sell orders, providing traders with the convenience of quick execution. According to reports from third-party authoritative data agenciesTokenInsightandSimplicity Group, MEXC’s Futures trading depth exceeds $100 million at both the 0.05% and 0.1% levels, consistently ranking first in the industry. The spot market depth also shows significant advantages.

In terms of slippage, MEXC offers the lowest slippage in Futures sell orders at $1 million and $5 million. The slippage in spot trading also demonstrates a clear advantage. MEXC maintains an absolute edge in fees, offering zero maker fees for regular users, further enhancing its market competitiveness.

Pembuat: Pembuat meletakkan pesanan dengan harga dan kuantiti yang ditentukan, menunggu pengguna lain untuk memadankannya. Pesanan Pembuat menambah kecairan kepada pasaran.

Pengambil: Pengambil secara aktif memadankan pesanan had atau pasaran sedia ada untuk pelaksanaan langsung. Pesanan Pengambil menggunakan kecairan daripada pasaran.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20250205113652632siPe1Bqk4qHaGv.png)

Di samping itu, anda boleh mendeposit MX ke dalam akaun Futures anda untuk mengimbangi yuran Pengambil, menikmati diskaun yuran tambahan sebanyak 20%. Untuk maklumat lanjut tentang kadar yuran MEXC, anda boleh merujuk kepada Yuran Berkaitan MEXC.

Adalah wajar untuk menyebut bahawa MEXC juga menawarkan kadar yuran terendah untuk dagangan spot di pasaran. Dalam dagangan spot, kadar yuran Pembuat ialah 0%, manakala kadar yuran Pengambil ialah 0.05%. Anda boleh menyemak kadar yuran terkini di halaman berikut: https://www.mexc.com/fee. Kadar yuran mungkin berbeza mengikut negara atau wilayah. Sila rujuk kepada kadar yang dipaparkan di halaman kadar yuran.



## 2. Kedalaman Dagangan yang Sangat Baik

Dengan pengalaman industri selama bertahun-tahun dan reputasi yang kukuh, MEXC telah mengumpul lebih 30 juta pengguna, menjadi pilihan pertama untuk pedagang baru dan berpengalaman. Perniagaannya merangkumi lebih 170 negara dan wilayah di seluruh dunia. Pangkalan pengguna MEXC Futures yang besar memastikan kedalaman pasaran yang sangat baik, dengan buku pesanan yang seimbang dan penetapan harga yang telus. Menurut data dagangan Futures MEXC pada masa penulisan ini, jumlah dagangan dalam tempoh 24 jam yang lalu melebihi $41.09 bilion. Ini memastikan bahawa pengguna boleh berdagang dengan lancar walaupun dalam keadaan pasaran yang melampau, mengelakkan penghapusan yang tidak dijangka. (Nota: Data setakat 12 November 2024.)


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20241114112510506IwFMrmTOjSwc7U.png)
Di samping itu, MEXC Futures mempunyai pelbagai jenis kripto mata wang, termasuk Futures kekal USDT-M, Metaverse, Layer2, NFT, Meme, DeFi, dan banyak lagi. Tambahan pula, keupayaan MEXC untuk menemui projek berkualiti tinggi dan menambah pilihan kripto mata wang baharu secara berterusan membolehkan pengguna mempunyai pengalaman dagangan terbaik.



## 3. Keselamatan dan Kestabilan yang Tinggi
Sistem dagangan MEXC mempunyai seni bina pelbagai lapisan dan pelbagai kelompok, dikuasakan oleh enjin dagangan berprestasi tinggi yang dibangunkan oleh pakar dengan pengetahuan teknologi perbankan khusus. Ia boleh memproses sehingga 1.4 juta transaksi sesaat, memberikan kecekapan dan prestasi yang inovatif.

Di samping itu, MEXC ialah platform dagangan yang paling selamat. Pengguna mendapat manfaat daripada pelbagai langkah keselamatan, termasuk pengesahan identiti, pengesahan dua faktor, dan kod anti-pancing. Pelayan kami juga dihoskan secara bebas di pelbagai negara untuk memastikan keselamatan dan integriti data pengguna.



## 4. Peraturan Dagangan yang Fleksibel
Peraturan dagangan Futures MEXC sangat fleksibel, dengan leverage boleh laras dari 1x hingga 400x. Futures kekal USDT-M menyokong leverage maksimum 400x, manakala Futures kekal Coin-M menyokong leverage sehingga 200x. Apabila berdagang Futures di MEXC, anda boleh memilih daripada pesanan had, pesanan pasaran, pesanan pencetus, pesanan berhenti-seret, pesanan hanya-pos, dan banyak lagi.

Dari segi sistem margin, pengguna mempunyai fleksibiliti untuk memilih antara mod margin silang dan margin terpencil. Untuk perbezaan antara mod margin silang dan margin terpencil, anda boleh merujuk kepada Mod Dagangan Futures MEXC. Di samping itu, MEXC juga menyokong mod lindung nilai, membenarkan pengguna memegang kedua-dua kedudukan panjang dan pendek untuk satu kontrak, dengan leverage ditetapkan secara bebas untuk setiap arah. Apabila memegang kedudukan dalam mod lindung nilai, kedudukan tersebut perlu menduduki margin yang sepadan mengikut tahap had risiko.

MEXC menawarkan kecairan terkemuka di industri, dengan buku pesanan yang mendalam, pesanan beli/jual yang kerap dan besar, memberikan pedagang kemudahan pelaksanaan yang cepat. Menurut laporan daripada agensi data pihak ketiga yang berwibawa TokenInsight dan Simplicity Group, kedalaman dagangan Futures MEXC melebihi $100 juta pada kedua-dua tahap 0.05% dan 0.1%, secara konsisten menduduki tempat pertama dalam industri. Kedalaman pasaran spot juga menunjukkan kelebihan yang ketara.

Dari segi gelinciran, MEXC menawarkan gelinciran terendah dalam pesanan jual Futures pada $1 juta dan $5 juta. Gelinciran dalam dagangan spot juga menunjukkan kelebihan yang jelas. MEXC mengekalkan kelebihan mutlak dalam yuran, menawarkan yuran pembuat sifar untuk pengguna biasa, selanjutnya meningkatkan daya saing pasarannya.

Futures are a form of derivative contracts that require the trading sides to complete a transaction of an asset at a fixed date and rate in the future. The buyer and seller have to follow the price set when the future contract is booked. This condition means that the price decided in the contract must be paid, regardless of the asset’s current price.



Future contracts can be for any physical commodities or any financial instrument. These contracts are detailed enough to list the quantities of the assets covered by the contract. Future contracts are commonly traded on futures exchanges like those offered by MEXC.



Futures are a common tool for hedging against falling market prices. Traders also use them to protect their regular trades from price fluctuations.





## 1.How does Futures work?
Futures contracts let traders fix the price of the asset in the contract. This asset can be any commonly traded commodity like oil, gold, silver, corn, sugar, and cotton. The underlying asset can also be shares, currency pairs, cryptocurrency, and treasury bonds.



A futures contract would lock in the price of any of these assets at a future date. A standard future contract has a maturity date, also known as its expiry and set price. The maturity date or month is commonly used to identify futures.



Corn futures contracts expiring in January are called January corn futures.

As a future contract buyer, you will be bound to take ownership of the commodity or asset at the contract’s maturity. This ownership can be in cash terms and does not always have to be physical asset ownership.



The main point to remember is that buyers can sell their futures contract to someone else and free themselves from their contractual obligation.

The Exchange allows user to change their long and short positions in cross margin modes. For instance, the long position is 30x, and the short position is 90x. To hedge against risk, the trader can adjust the trade leverage from 90x to 30x



The platform supports traders with different margin preferences by offering different margin modes.

The cross-marginmode shares margins with two positions opened against the same cryptocurrency. Any profit or loss from a position can be used to adjust against the balance of the other trade.

As a default setting, all traders start trading in isolated margin mode.

Kontrak hadapan akan mengunci harga mana-mana aset ini pada tarikh akan datang. Kontrak hadapan standard mempunyai tarikh matang, juga dikenali sebagai tarikh tamat tempoh dan harga yang ditetapkan. Tarikh matang atau bulan biasanya digunakan untuk mengenal pasti niaga hadapan.



Kontrak hadapan jagung yang tamat tempoh pada Januari dipanggil niaga hadapan jagung Januari.

Sebagai pembeli kontrak hadapan, anda akan terikat untuk memiliki komoditi atau aset tersebut pada tarikh matang kontrak. Pemilikan ini boleh dalam bentuk tunai dan tidak semestinya pemilikan aset fizikal.

The MEXC futures trading platform is divided into USDT-M futures and Coin-M futures :

• Set the [Position Mode], [Margin Mode], and [Leverage Mode] → Choose the order mode → Set parameters → Confirm the order [Open Short] / [Open Long].



## 3.1 Setting the [Position Mode]
[Hedge Mode]: You can simultaneously hold both long and short positions for a single futures trading pair.

[One-Way Mode]:You can only hold one type of position (either long or short) for a single futures trading pair.

For example, in Hedge mode, you can hold both long and short positions for the BTC/USDT futures trading pair. In One-Way Mode, you can only hold either a long or short position for the BTC/USDT futures trading pair.

Relationship between [Position Mode] and Existing Positions/Orders: Once you have existing positions or open orders, adjusting the Position Mode is not allowed.

Isolated Margin: In this mode, the position for each order is calculated independently when the order is triggered. If it is necessary to add positions, even if you have sufficient assets in other isolated margin accounts or cross margin accounts, it will not automatically add positions for that trading pair. You will need to manually add positions.

Example: In isolated margin mode, a user has 1,000 USDT in the futures account, uses only 200 USDT as initial margin, and opens a long position in BTC. When facing liquidation, the user will only lose 200 USDT, not the entire USDT balance in the account.

Cross Margin: In this mode, you use all available balances in the corresponding settlement currency as position margin to maintain your position and avoid liquidation. In cross margin mode, if the net asset value is insufficient to meet the maintenance margin requirement, forced liquidation will be triggered. If the position is forcibly liquidated, you will lose all assets in the corresponding settlement currency.

Example: In cross margin mode, a user has 1,000 USDT in the futures account, uses only 200 USDT as initial margin, and opens a long position in BTC. When facing liquidation, the user will lose the entire USDT balance in the account.

Relationship between Margin Mode and Existing Positions/Orders: Adjusting the margin mode does not affect existing positions and open orders.

On MEXC, MEXCers can not only buy cryptocurrency through spot trading, but also potentially achieve higher profits through futures trading with up to 400x leverage. So, what's the difference between spot trading and futures trading? Traders stand to earn different returns from each type of trading, but what else distinguishes these two? After reading this article, you should be able to understand the basics of both spot and futures trading.



## 1. Different Investment Targets
• When spot trading on MEXC, MEXCers can buy and sellcryptocurrencies,like 1 BTC or 1 ETH. After purchasing cryptocurrencies through spot trading, MEXCers own those assets and can freely transfer them across different blockchain networks.

• When futures trading, however, MEXCers buy and sellperpetual contracts. For example, when you purchase 1,000 cont. of BTC/USDT, this portion of your assets cannot and will not be transferred through any blockchain network.



## 2. Different Trading Variety
Generally speaking, only spot trading pairs listed on MEXC have corresponding futures trading pairs. However,not all spot trading pairs have corresponding futures trading pairs. Also,not all futures trading pairs support 300x leverage, like the MX token for example.



## 2.1 Earning Methods
At MEXC, the profit mechanism for spot trading is aone-way market T+0, which means traderscan only go long and cannot short a position. Positions can be sold immediately after they have been bought. On the other hand, the profit mechanism for futures trading is atwo-sided marketT+0, allowing traders tohold both long and short positions. Positions can be closed immediately after they have been opened.



## 2.2 Leverage
Spot trading does not require or support leverage. The leverage in futures trading is reflected by the initial margin. When trading futures,traders can hold a large position value with asmall amount of initial margin,therebyincreasing the potential return on investment.



## 3. Different Trading Methods
Due to the different investment targets of spot trading and futures trading, MEXCers will encountervastly different trading scenarioswhen chasing profits using either of these trading methods. While there may be some scenarios where spot and futures trading share similar mechanisms,the differences between the two remain significant in most cases. To understand these differences in trading methods, let's look at them individually from the simplest to the most complex.



## 3.1 Differences in Trading Scenarios Before Holding Positions
3.1.1 Order Placement Methods

When spot trading, you can choose from four types of orders on the spot trading interface: Limit, Market, Trigger, Trailing Stop, and Post Only.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F202404051416574522N9T2tbXwkQZug.png]
On the futures trading interface, you can find a more diverse array of order placement options. You can select amongfive order types: Limit, Market, Trigger, Trailing Stop, and Post Only.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240403232317549Tu7AtG6Jujxc4Z.png]
If you want to learn more about the specific order types for spot and futures trading, please visit MEXC Learn.

3.1.2 Settlement Price

• Spot trading matches transactions for immediate delivery, so thelast pricerepresents the settlement price for spot trading.

• The settlement price for futures differs from that of spot trading: MEXC adopts a uniquely designedfair pricemarking system to avoid unnecessary liquidations on high-leverage products.

3.1.3 Position Modes

On MEXC, spot trading does not have specific position mode settings. However, futures trading offers more position mode options, includingHedgeModeandOne-WayMode.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240403232317489JQ2ps6z3jLb8nL.png]
3.1.4 Leverage Modes

Similarly, spot trading does not offer leveraged trading. However, leveraging in futures trading is common practice. Here, MEXC specifically provides users with two leverage mode settings: Simple Mode and Advanced Mode. As with position modes, MEXCers need to configure these settings before opening a position.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240403232318327UM2vERHLtl4tzl.png]


## 3.2 Different Trading Scenarios While Holding Positions
3.2.1 Different Order Placement Methods

When spot trading, you can choose from four types of orders on the spot trading interface: limit, market, stop-limit, or OCO (One-Cancels-the-Other).


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240405141657449QzWjjylWnKDvc3.png]
On the futures trading interface, you can find a more diverse array of order placement options. You can select amongfive order types:Limit order, Market order, Trigger order, Trailing Stop order, and Post Only order. In addition to these, you can also utilize features such as addingTP/SL(both[Position TP/SL]and[TP/SL inBatches]),[FlashClose],and[CloseShort]/[Reverse]functions.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240403232316949a8LLPdjVTGOg2t.png]



[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240403232317531KSFvbtVxUEAi2S.png]


## 4. Conclusion
The most important thing to consider when choosing a trading method is to make sure it aligns with your investment goals:

• If MEXCers adopt a risk-averse investment attitude based on their capital and risk preferences, then spot trading is suitable for their needs.Spot trading carries no risk of liquidation.Also, in the spot market,delistingsortoken price collapsesare rare.

• If some MEXCers consider the investment cost of certain cryptocurrencies (e.g., BTC) to be too high and find it challenging to achieve high returns without a prolonged one-sided uptrend after investment, thenfuturestradingcan meet the demands forhigher investment returns and shorter recovery periods. However, it is crucial to be cautious as poor judgment calls and user errors in future trading can be risky, sometimes resulting in liquidation.

Di MEXC, MEXCers bukan sahaja boleh membeli mata wang kripto melalui perdagangan spot, malah berpotensi mencapai keuntungan yang lebih tinggi melalui perdagangan niaga hadapan dengan leverage sehingga 400x. Jadi, apakah perbezaan antara perdagangan spot dan perdagangan niaga hadapan? Peniaga berpeluang memperoleh pulangan yang berbeza daripada setiap jenis perdagangan, tetapi apakah lagi yang membezakan kedua-duanya? Selepas membaca artikel ini, anda seharusnya dapat memahami asas-asas perdagangan spot dan niaga hadapan.



## 1. Sasaran Pelaburan Berbeza
• Apabila melakukan perdagangan spot di MEXC, MEXCers boleh membeli dan menjual mata wang kripto, seperti 1 BTC atau 1 ETH. Selepas membeli mata wang kripto melalui perdagangan spot, MEXCers memiliki aset tersebut dan boleh memindahkannya dengan bebas merentas rangkaian blok yang berbeza.

• Walau bagaimanapun, apabila melakukan perdagangan niaga hadapan, MEXCers membeli dan menjual kontrak kekal. Contohnya, apabila anda membeli 1,000 kont. BTC/USDT, bahagian aset anda ini tidak boleh dan tidak akan dipindahkan melalui sebarang rangkaian blok.



## 2. Kepelbagaian Perdagangan Berbeza
Secara umumnya, hanya pasangan perdagangan spot yang disenaraikan di MEXC mempunyai pasangan perdagangan niaga hadapan yang sepadan. Walau bagaimanapun, tidak semua pasangan perdagangan spot mempunyai pasangan perdagangan niaga hadapan yang sepadan.  Juga, tidak semua pasangan perdagangan niaga hadapan menyokong leverage 300x, seperti token MX sebagai contoh.



## 2.1 Kaedah Pendapatan
Di MEXC, mekanisme keuntungan untuk perdagangan spot ialah pasaran sehala T+0, yang bermaksud peniaga hanya boleh membeli dan tidak boleh menjual pendek posisi. Posisi boleh dijual serta-merta selepas dibeli. Sebaliknya, mekanisme keuntungan untuk perdagangan niaga hadapan ialah pasaran dua hala T+0, yang membenarkan peniaga memegang kedua-dua posisi beli dan posisi jual pendek. Posisi boleh ditutup serta-merta selepas dibuka.



## 2.2 Leverage
Perdagangan spot tidak memerlukan atau menyokong leverage. Leverage dalam perdagangan niaga hadapan dicerminkan oleh margin awal. Apabila berdagang niaga hadapan, peniaga boleh memegang nilai posisi yang besar dengan jumlah margin awal yang kecil, dengan itu meningkatkan pulangan pelaburan yang berpotensi.



## 3. Kaedah Perdagangan Berbeza
Oleh kerana sasaran pelaburan yang berbeza bagi perdagangan spot dan perdagangan niaga hadapan, MEXCers akan menghadapi senario perdagangan yang sangat berbeza apabila mengejar keuntungan menggunakan mana-mana kaedah perdagangan ini. Walaupun mungkin terdapat beberapa senario di mana perdagangan spot dan niaga hadapan berkongsi mekanisme yang serupa, perbezaan antara kedua-duanya tetap ketara dalam kebanyakan kes. Untuk memahami perbezaan dalam kaedah perdagangan ini, mari kita lihatnya secara individu daripada yang paling mudah hingga yang paling kompleks.



## 3.1 Perbezaan dalam Senario Perdagangan Sebelum Memegang Posisi

Jika anda ingin mengetahui lebih lanjut tentang jenis pesanan khusus untuk perdagangan spot dan niaga hadapan, sila lawati MEXC Learn.

3.1.2 Harga Penyelesaian

• Perdagangan spot memadankan transaksi untuk penghantaran segera, jadi harga terakhir mewakili harga penyelesaian untuk perdagangan spot.

• Harga penyelesaian untuk niaga hadapan berbeza daripada perdagangan spot: MEXC menggunakan sistem penanda harga yang adil yang direka secara unik untuk mengelakkan penghapusan yang tidak perlu pada produk leverage tinggi.

3.1.3 Mod Posisi

Di sini, MEXC secara khusus menyediakan pengguna dengan dua tetapan mod leverage: Mod Mudah dan Mod Lanjutan. Seperti mod posisi, MEXCers perlu mengkonfigurasikan tetapan ini sebelum membuka posisi.

Anda boleh memilih antara lima jenis pesanan: Pesanan Had, Pesanan Pasaran, Pesanan Pencetus, Pesanan Hentian Seret, dan Pesanan Hanya Pos. ## 4. Kesimpulan
Perkara yang paling penting untuk dipertimbangkan apabila memilih kaedah perdagangan adalah untuk memastikan ia sejajar dengan matlamat pelaburan anda:

• Jika MEXCers mengamalkan sikap pelaburan yang menghindari risiko berdasarkan modal dan keutamaan risiko mereka, maka perdagangan spot sesuai untuk keperluan mereka. Perdagangan spot tidak membawa risiko penghapusan. Selain itu, dalam pasaran spot, penyahsenaraian atau kejatuhan harga token adalah jarang berlaku.

• Jika sesetengah MEXCers menganggap kos pelaburan mata wang kripto tertentu (cth., BTC) terlalu tinggi dan mendapati ia mencabar untuk mencapai pulangan yang tinggi tanpa peningkatan sehala yang berpanjangan selepas pelaburan, maka perdagangan niaga hadapan boleh memenuhi permintaan untuk pulangan pelaburan yang lebih tinggi dan tempoh pemulihan yang lebih pendek. Walau bagaimanapun, adalah penting untuk berhati-hati kerana panggilan penghakiman yang buruk dan kesilapan pengguna dalam perdagangan niaga hadapan boleh menjadi berisiko, kadang-kadang mengakibatkan penghapusan.

Futures trading is an important part of the cryptocurrency market, where traders use leverage flexibly to lock in a portion of their margin for long and short trades, aiming to achieve high returns from small investments. This guide aims to provide beginners with a detailed overview of operations to easily start futures trading.

On MEXC, futures trading is divided into USDT-M perpetual futures and Coin-M perpetual futures. This guide will focus on USDT-M futures for web-based futures trading. If you're more comfortable using the app for futures trading, you can check out the article "MEXC Futures Trading Tutorial (App)" to learn more.



## 1. Transferring Funds
Before trading futures, ensure that your futures account has the corresponding assets, namely USDT. If your futures account does not have USDT, you can transfer from spot assets. There is no fee for these transfer operations.

Open the MEXC official website and log in to your account. Click on [Wallets] in the top right corner, then click on [Futures].

Click the [Transfer] button on the right side to transfer assets from your spot account to your futures account. Choose USDT under the [Crypto] section and enter the amount you want to transfer under [Quantity]. Click [Transfer] to complete the transaction.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240409180204369BtXZgzeRNZfkbb.png]


## 2. How to Place an Order
Because [Position Mode], [Margin Mode], and [Leverage Mode] can significantly affect your profits and losses in futures trading, MEXC suggests that you follow these steps to place an order:



• Set your [Position Mode], [Margin Mode], and [Leverage Mode].
• Select the order mode.
• Set your parameters.
• Complete the order by choosing either [Open Long] or [Open Short].



## 2.1 SettingPositionMode
Position mode on MEXC is divided into hedge mode and one-way mode. The difference lies in whether you can hold both long and short positions for a trading pair concurrently.

For example, if you plan to trade BTC/USDT perpetual futures, in hedge mode, you can hold both long and short positions for the BTC/USDT futures pair at the same time, while in one-way mode, you can only hold either a long or short position.

On the MEXC website, select [Futures] in the top navigation bar, then choose [USDT-M Perpetual Futures] under [Perpetual Futures] to enter the trading page. On the trading page, switch to the BTC/USDT perpetual futures trading pair.

Click on the settings [⚙️] button in the upper right corner to open the preferences page.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240409180204403WSJvjSzzUQjA5a.png]
In the preferences page, navigate to [Position Mode] under the trading settings, and select either [Hedge Mode] or [One-Way Mode]. Once you've made your choice, click [Confirm] to save the settings. Here, we will illustrate using hedge mode.

Note that you cannot adjust the position mode if you already have open positions or orders.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240409180205276YQ93mtlnSGIDnK.png]


## 2.2 SettingMarginMode
The MEXC platform has two margin modes: cross margin and isolated margin.

In cross margin mode, you use all available balances in the corresponding settlement crypto as position margin to maintain the position and avoid liquidation. In this margin mode, if the asset net value is insufficient to meet the maintenance margin requirement, forced liquidation will be triggered. If the position is forcibly liquidated, you will lose all assets in the corresponding cryptocurrency.

In isolated margin mode, each order's position is calculated independently after being triggered. If you need to add margin, even if you have sufficient assets in other isolated or cross margin accounts, the system will not automatically add margin to that trading pair, and you will need to manually add margin.

Click on [Cross] or [Isolated] on the right side of the MEXC futures trading page to open the margin mode setting pop-up. Choose your settings and click [Confirm] to activate. Here we demonstrate with the cross margin mode.

Please note that the adjusted margin mode does not apply to existing positions and orders.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F202404091802078811oOOSrFamQCoZJ.png]


## 2.3Setting Leverage Mode
MEXC's leverage modes are divided into Simple Mode and Advanced Mode. The difference lies in whether long and short positions use leverage with the same or different multipliers and margin modes.

Click the settings icon [⚙️] in the upper right corner of the trading page to open preferences page, click on [Leverage Mode] under trading settings, choose either [Simple Mode] or [Advanced Mode], then click [Confirm].


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F2024040918020567276EEJj5snwcod0.png]
Here we demonstrate using Advanced Mode as an example. The advanced mode allows long and short positions to use different leverage multipliers and margin modes. As shown in the figure below, the long position uses 25x leverage in isolated margin mode, while the short position uses 20x leverage in cross margin mode.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240409180205387dM0JUqyeNGZmbs.png]


## 2.4 SettingOrderPlacementMode
MEXC supports five different types of order modes, namely limit orders, market orders, trigger orders, trailing stop orders, and post only orders. If you want to learn more about these order modes, you can read the article: "Placing Different Types of Futures Orders"


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F202404091802042727fOV1dS69KTMzF.png]
Let's demonstrate order placement using a limit order mode as an example.

Set the margin mode to [Cross], leverage to [20x], and choose the [Limit] mode. Enter the target price in the [Price] field below. In this example, we will use 65,000 USDT, and input the [Quantity] as 49%. Click on either [Open Long] or [Open Short] below to complete the order.

If your order has not yet been triggered, you can check it in the [Open Orders] section below, as shown in the image below. If your order has been triggered, you can check it in the [Open Positions] section.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240409180203355eHkA1lNAXuw4tK.png]
3.1 Closing Positions

If your order has been triggered and results in profit or loss, you can actively [Close] your position according to your expectations. You can also proactively [Close] your position by setting up TP/SL functions before or after placing an order. For more information, please refer to the article "Setting Take-Profit and Stop-Loss for Futures Trading."

Forced liquidation is a passive liquidation action. MEXC ensures that losses do not exceed the margin you deposited. When the existing margin falls below the required amount to maintain the position, the open positions will be forcibly settled. For more information, please refer to the article "What is Forced Liquidation?"

Dagangan futures merupakan bahagian penting dalam pasaran kripto, di mana pedagang menggunakan leverage secara fleksibel untuk mengunci sebahagian daripada margin mereka untuk dagangan panjang dan pendek, yang bertujuan untuk mencapai pulangan yang tinggi daripada pelaburan yang kecil. Panduan ini bertujuan untuk memberikan gambaran keseluruhan yang terperinci tentang operasi kepada pemula supaya mereka dapat memulakan dagangan futures dengan mudah.

Di MEXC, dagangan futures dibahagikan kepada futures kekal USDT-M dan futures kekal Coin-M. Panduan ini akan menumpukan pada futures USDT-M untuk dagangan futures berasaskan web. Jika anda lebih selesa menggunakan aplikasi untuk dagangan futures, anda boleh menyemak artikel "Tutorial Dagangan Futures MEXC (Aplikasi)" untuk mengetahui lebih lanjut.



## 1. Pemindahan Dana
Sebelum berdagang futures, pastikan akaun futures anda mempunyai aset yang sepadan, iaitu USDT. Jika akaun futures anda tidak mempunyai USDT, anda boleh memindahkan daripada aset spot. Tiada yuran untuk operasi pemindahan ini.

Buka laman web rasmi MEXC dan log masuk ke akaun anda. Klik pada [Dompet] di penjuru kanan atas, kemudian klik pada [Futures].


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20241204104959230PY1eVjivGkcWFe.png)
Klik butang [Pindahkan] di sebelah kanan untuk memindahkan aset daripada akaun spot anda ke akaun futures anda. Pilih USDT di bawah bahagian [Kripto] dan masukkan amaun yang ingin anda pindahkan di bawah [Kuantiti]. Klik [Pindahkan] untuk melengkapkan transaksi.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240409180204369BtXZgzeRNZfkbb.png)


## 2. Cara Menempatkan Pesanan
Kerana [Mod Posisi], [Mod Margin], dan [Mod Leverage] boleh memberi kesan yang ketara kepada keuntungan dan kerugian anda dalam dagangan futures, MEXC mencadangkan anda mengikuti langkah-langkah berikut untuk menempatkan pesanan:



• Tetapkan [Mod Posisi], [Mod Margin], dan [Mod Leverage] anda.
• Pilih mod pesanan.
• Tetapkan parameter anda.
• Lengkapkan pesanan dengan memilih sama ada [Buka Panjang] atau [Buka Pendek].



## 2.1 Menetapkan Mod Posisi
Mod posisi pada MEXC dibahagikan kepada mod lindung nilai dan mod sehala. Perbezaannya terletak pada sama ada anda boleh memegang kedudukan panjang dan pendek untuk pasangan dagangan pada masa yang sama.

Sebagai contoh, jika anda merancang untuk berdagang futures kekal BTC/USDT, dalam mod lindung nilai, anda boleh memegang kedua-dua kedudukan panjang dan pendek untuk pasangan futures BTC/USDT pada masa yang sama, manakala dalam mod sehala, anda hanya boleh memegang sama ada kedudukan panjang atau pendek.

Di laman web MEXC, pilih [Futures] di bar navigasi atas, kemudian pilih [Futures Kekal USDT-M] di bawah [Futures Kekal] untuk memasuki halaman dagangan. Di halaman dagangan, tukar kepada pasangan dagangan futures kekal BTC/USDT.

Klik pada butang tetapan [⚙️] di penjuru kanan atas untuk membuka halaman keutamaan.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240409180204403WSJvjSzzUQjA5a.png)
Di halaman keutamaan, navigasi ke [Mod Posisi] di bawah tetapan dagangan, dan pilih sama ada [Mod Lindung Nilai] atau [Mod Sehala]. Sebaik sahaja anda membuat pilihan anda, klik [Sahkan] untuk menyimpan tetapan. Di sini, kami akan menggambarkan menggunakan mod lindung nilai.

Perlu diingat bahawa anda tidak boleh melaraskan mod posisi jika anda sudah mempunyai kedudukan atau pesanan terbuka.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240409180205276YQ93mtlnSGIDnK.png)


## 2.2 Menetapkan Mod Margin
Platform MEXC mempunyai dua mod margin: margin silang dan margin terpencil.

Dalam mod margin silang, anda menggunakan semua baki yang tersedia dalam kripto penyelesaian yang sepadan sebagai margin posisi untuk mengekalkan posisi dan mengelakkan penghapusan. Dalam mod margin ini, jika nilai bersih aset tidak mencukupi untuk memenuhi keperluan margin penyelenggaraan, penghapusan paksa akan dicetuskan. Jika posisi tersebut dihapuskan secara paksa, anda akan kehilangan semua aset dalam kripto yang sepadan.

Dalam mod margin terpencil, setiap posisi pesanan dikira secara bebas selepas dicetuskan. Jika anda perlu menambah margin, walaupun anda mempunyai aset yang mencukupi dalam akaun margin terpencil atau silang yang lain, sistem tidak akan menambah margin secara automatik kepada pasangan dagangan tersebut, dan anda perlu menambah margin secara manual.

Klik pada [Silang] atau [Terpencil] di sebelah kanan halaman dagangan futures MEXC untuk membuka pop timbul tetapan mod margin. Pilih tetapan anda dan klik [Sahkan] untuk mengaktifkan. Di sini kami menunjukkan dengan mod margin silang.

Sila ambil perhatian bahawa mod margin yang dilaraskan tidak terpakai kepada kedudukan dan pesanan sedia ada.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F202404091802078811oOOSrFamQCoZJ.png)


## 2.3 Menetapkan Mod Leverage
Mod leverage MEXC dibahagikan kepada Mod Mudah dan Mod Lanjutan. Perbezaannya terletak pada sama ada kedudukan panjang dan pendek menggunakan leverage dengan pendarab dan mod margin yang sama atau berbeza.

Klik ikon tetapan [⚙️] di penjuru kanan atas halaman dagangan untuk membuka halaman keutamaan, klik pada [Mod Leverage] di bawah tetapan dagangan, pilih sama ada [Mod Mudah] atau [Mod Lanjutan], kemudian klik [Sahkan].


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F2024040918020567276EEJj5snwcod0.png)
Di sini kami menunjukkan menggunakan Mod Lanjutan sebagai contoh. Mod lanjutan membenarkan kedudukan panjang dan pendek untuk menggunakan pendarab leverage dan mod margin yang berbeza. Seperti yang ditunjukkan dalam gambar di bawah, kedudukan panjang menggunakan leverage 25x dalam mod margin terpencil, manakala kedudukan pendek menggunakan leverage 20x dalam mod margin silang.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240409180205387dM0JUqyeNGZmbs.png)


## 2.4 Menetapkan Mod Penempatan Pesanan
MEXC menyokong lima jenis mod pesanan yang berbeza, iaitu pesanan had, pesanan pasaran, pesanan pencetus, pesanan berhenti tertinggal, dan pesanan hanya siaran. Jika anda ingin mengetahui lebih lanjut tentang mod pesanan ini, anda boleh membaca artikel: "Menempatkan Pelbagai Jenis Pesanan Futures"


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F202404091802042727fOV1dS69KTMzF.png)
Mari kita tunjukkan penempatan pesanan menggunakan mod pesanan had sebagai contoh.

Tetapkan mod margin kepada [Silang], leverage kepada [20x], dan pilih mod [Had]. Masukkan harga sasaran dalam medan [Harga] di bawah. Dalam contoh ini, kami akan menggunakan 65,000 USDT, dan masukkan [Kuantiti] sebagai 49%. Klik pada sama ada [Buka Panjang] atau [Buka Pendek] di bawah untuk melengkapkan pesanan.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240409180204772xUidifSApHuesP.png)


## 3. Pemantauan Pesanan
Jika pesanan anda belum dicetuskan, anda boleh menyemaknya di bahagian [Pesanan Terbuka] di bawah, seperti yang ditunjukkan dalam gambar di bawah. Jika pesanan anda telah dicetuskan, anda boleh menyemaknya di bahagian [Kedudukan Terbuka].


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240409180203355eHkA1lNAXuw4tK.png)
3.1 Menutup Kedudukan

Jika pesanan anda telah dicetuskan dan menghasilkan keuntungan atau kerugian, anda boleh secara aktif [Tutup] kedudukan anda mengikut jangkaan anda. Anda juga boleh secara proaktif [Tutup] kedudukan anda dengan menyediakan fungsi TP/SL sebelum atau selepas meletakkan pesanan. Untuk maklumat lanjut, sila rujuk artikel "Menetapkan Keuntungan Ambil dan Kerugian Berhenti untuk Dagangan Futures."

3.2 Penghapusan Paksa

Penghapusan paksa ialah tindakan penghapusan pasif. MEXC memastikan bahawa kerugian tidak melebihi margin yang anda deposit. Apabila margin sedia ada jatuh di bawah jumlah yang diperlukan untuk mengekalkan posisi, posisi terbuka akan diselesaikan secara paksa. Untuk maklumat lanjut, sila rujuk artikel "Apakah Penghapusan Paksa?"

For beginners, futures trading can be more complex than spot trading, as it involves a greater number of professional terms. To help new users understand and master futures trading effectively, this article aims to explain the meanings of these terms as they appear on the MEXC futures trading page.

We will introduce these terms in order of appearance, starting from left to right.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240207130412166D2D7YEB1EiBfwp.png]


## 1. Terms above the K-line chart
Perpetual:"Perpetual" denotes continuity. The commonly seen "perpetual futures" (also known as perpetual futures contracts) evolved from traditional financial futures contracts, with the key difference being that perpetual futures have no settlement date. This means that as long as the position is not closed due to forced liquidation, it will remain open indefinitely.

Index Price:The comprehensive price index obtained by referencing the prices of major mainstream exchanges and calculating the weighted average of their prices. The index price displayed on the current page is the MX index price.

Fair Price:The real-time fair price of the futures, calculated based on the index price and market price. It is used to calculate the floating PNL of positions and determine position liquidation. It may deviate from the last price of the futures to avoid price manipulation.

Funding Rate / Countdown:The funding rate in the current stage. If the rate is positive, long position holders pay the funding fee to short position holders. If the rate is negative, short position holders pay the funding fee to long position holders.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20231104093946946rqHD22j6FKPAKM.png]


## 2. Terms in the order book area
Order Book:A window to observe market trends during the trading process. In the order book area, you can observe each trade, the proportion of buyers and sellers, and more.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20231104093947118tJPSeGzaAQzu5N.png]


## 3. Terms in the trading area
Open and Close:After entering the price and quantity based on your judgment of the market direction, you can choose to open a long or short position. If you predict an increase in price, you open a long position; if you predict a decrease, you open a short position. When you sell the contract you bought, you close the position. When you open a position by purchasing a contract and hold it without settling, it is called a holding position. You can view your holding positions by clicking on [Open Position] at the bottom of the page.

Open Long:When you predict that the token price will rise in the future and open a position based on this trend, it is known as opening a long position.

Open Short:When you predict that the token price will fall in the future and open a position based on this trend, it is known as opening a short position.

Margin and Margin Mode:Users can engage in futures trading after depositing a certain percentage of funds as financial collateral. This fund is known as margin. The margin mode is divided into isolated margin or cross margin.

Isolated:In isolated margin mode, a certain amount of margin is allocated to a position. If the margin for a position decreases to a level below the maintenance margin, the position will be liquidated. You can also choose to add or reduce margin to this position.

Cross:In cross margin mode, all positions share the cross margin of the asset. In the event of liquidation, the trader may lose all the margin and all positions under the cross margin of that asset.

Order Types:The order types are divided into limit order, market order, trigger order, trailing stop order, and post-only order.

Limit:A limit order is an order placed to buy or sell at a specific price or better. However, a limit order's execution isn't guaranteed.

Market:A market order is an order placed to buy or sell quickly at the best available price in the market.

Trigger:For trigger orders, users can set a trigger price, order price, and quantity in advance. When the market price reaches the trigger price, the system will automatically place an order at the order price. Before the trigger order is triggered successfully, the position or margin will not be frozen.

Trailing Stop:A trailing stop order is submitted to the market based on the user's settings as a strategic order when the market is in a retracement. Actual Trigger Price = Market's Highest (Lowest) Price ± Trail Variance (Price Distance), or Market's Highest (Lowest) Price * (1 ± Trail Variance). At the same time, users can set the price at which the order is activated before the trigger price is calculated.

Post Only:A post-only order will not be immediately executed in the market, ensuring that the user will always be the maker. If the order were to be matched with an existing order immediately, it would be canceled.

TP/SL:A TP/SL order is an order with preset trigger conditions (take profit price or stop-loss price). When the last price / fair price / index price reaches the preset trigger price, the system will close the position at the best market price, based on the preset trigger price and quantity. This is done to achieve the goal of taking profit or stopping losses, allowing users to automatically settle the desired profit or avoid unnecessary losses.

Stop Limit Order:A stop limit order is a preset order where users can set the stop-loss price, limit price, and buy/sell amount in advance. When the last price reaches the stop-loss price, the system will automatically place an order at the limit price.

COIN-M:Coin-margined futures provided by MEXC are a reverse contract that uses cryptocurrency as collateral, meaning that cryptocurrency serves as the base currency. For example, in the case of BTC coin-margined futures, Bitcoin is used as the initial margin and for PNL calculations.

USDT-M:USDT-margined futures provided by MEXC is a linear contract, which is a linear derivative product quoted and settled in USDT, a stablecoin pegged to the value of the US dollar.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240207130411037xJqFxZAdTeGKQA.png]


## 4. Terms in the Futures Calculator Area
PNL: Enter your entry price, the quantity of futures you hold, and the leverage multiplier. Then, set your expected close price to calculate the final earnings and yield.

Target Price: Enter your entry price, the quantity of futures you hold, and the leverage multiplier. Then, set your desired yield to calculate the final earnings and yield.

Liquidation Price: Enter your entry price, the quantity of futures you hold, and the leverage multiplier. Then, select the margin mode (cross or isolated) to calculate your liquidation price.

Max Open: Enter your entry price, leverage multiplier, and your available margin amount to calculate the maximum number of contracts you can open for a long/short position.

Entry Price: When you have multiple futures positions for the same trading pair, enter the respective entry prices and the corresponding futures quantities. You can calculate the average entry price for contracts of the same trading pair.

Funding Fee: Enter the fair price, position quantity, and the funding rate (0.01%) to calculate the amount of funding fee you need to pay or receive.

Note: The results calculated using the futures calculator are for reference purposes only, and the actual results in live trading will prevail.

For beginners, before engaging in futures trading for the first time, you can practice on the MEXCFutures Demo Tradinginterface to familiarize yourself with various features before entering the live trading platform for trading.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20231104093947137t3ZbIuqvvId3aw.png]


## 5. Terms in the order area below the K-line chart


## 5.1 Open Position
Position:Number of contracts in positions that have not yet been closed.

Avg Entry Price:The average cost price when a user opens a position. For instance, if a user opens a long position of 100 cont in MX/USDT perpetual futures at 2 USDT and later opens another position of 100 contracts in the same direction at 2.1 USDT, the user's average entry price would be calculated as follows: (2 * 100 + 2.1 * 100) / (100 + 100) = 2.05 USDT.

Fair Price:This mechanism was introduced to protect users from losses due to abnormal market fluctuations on a single platform. It is calculated by weighting price data from mainstream exchanges, providing a fair reflection of the real market price. For more information about the fair price, you can refer to the article "Index Price, Fair Price and Last Price."

Est. Liq Price:When the fair price reaches the estimated liquidation price, your position will undergo forced liquidation. For more details on forced liquidation, you can refer to the article "Forced Liquidation."


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20231104093947434TopZC0AAswN15O.png]


## 5.2 Open Order
Amount and Filled Amount:"Amount" refers to the desired trading volume set by the user before placing an order. When users place large orders, the order is usually split into multiple smaller orders, which are filled sequentially. "Filled Amount" refers to the actual quantity that has been traded. When the order amount equals the filled amount, it means the order has been completely filled.

Order Price and Filled Price: "Order Price" refers to the desired trading price entered by the user when placing an order. If a user chooses a limit order, the order price is the price entered by the user. If the user selects a market order, the order price depends on the actual trading results. When users place large orders, the order is usually split into multiple smaller orders, which are filled sequentially. Due to market fluctuations, the actual filled price of each order may vary. "Filled Price" refers to the average of these actual filled prices.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F202311040939474303sGRvBR8a4lLae.png]


## 5.3 Position History
Avg Entry Price:The average cost to open a position.

Avg Close Price:The average price of all closed positions.

Realized PNL:All realized profits and losses generated by the position, including trading fees, funding costs, and closing PNL. (Excluding portions of trading fees offset using coupons and MX.)


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20231104093947178uN5g5C36Zcrnnj.png]


## 5.4 Wallet
Total Equity:Wallet Balance + Unrealized PNL.

Wallet Balance:Total Inbound Transfers – Total Outbound Transfers + Realized PNL.Understanding the terms related to futures trading is just the first step in learning how to use futures tools. Next, you need to gain practical experience through trading. Before trading futures, you can practice using the futuresDemo Tradingplatform provided by MEXC. Bagi pemula, niaga hadapan mungkin lebih kompleks daripada niaga spot, kerana ia melibatkan lebih banyak istilah profesional. Untuk membantu pengguna baru memahami dan menguasai niaga hadapan dengan berkesan, artikel ini bertujuan untuk menerangkan maksud istilah-istilah ini seperti yang muncul di halaman niaga hadapan MEXC.

Kami akan memperkenalkan istilah ini mengikut urutan kemunculan, bermula dari kiri ke kanan.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240207130412166D2D7YEB1EiBfwp.png)


## 1. Istilah di atas carta K-line
Perpetual: "Perpetual" menunjukkan kesinambungan. "Niaga hadapan perpetual" yang biasa dilihat (juga dikenali sebagai kontrak niaga hadapan perpetual) telah berkembang daripada kontrak niaga hadapan kewangan tradisional, dengan perbezaan utama ialah niaga hadapan perpetual tidak mempunyai tarikh penyelesaian. Ini bermakna selagi kedudukan tidak ditutup disebabkan oleh penghapusan paksa, ia akan kekal terbuka tanpa had.

Harga Indeks: Indeks harga komprehensif yang diperolehi dengan merujuk kepada harga bursa aliran utama utama dan mengira purata berwajaran harga mereka. Harga indeks yang dipaparkan pada halaman semasa ialah harga indeks MX.

Harga Adil: Harga adil masa nyata niaga hadapan, dikira berdasarkan harga indeks dan harga pasaran. Ia digunakan untuk mengira PNL terapung kedudukan dan menentukan penghapusan kedudukan. Ia mungkin menyimpang daripada harga terakhir niaga hadapan untuk mengelakkan manipulasi harga.

Kadar Pembiayaan / Kiraan Masa: Kadar pembiayaan dalam peringkat semasa. Jika kadarnya positif, pemegang kedudukan panjang membayar yuran pembiayaan kepada pemegang kedudukan pendek. Jika kadarnya negatif, pemegang kedudukan pendek membayar yuran pembiayaan kepada pemegang kedudukan panjang.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20231104093946946rqHD22j6FKPAKM.png)


## 2. Istilah di kawasan buku pesanan
Buku Pesanan: Tetingkap untuk memerhati trend pasaran semasa proses perdagangan. Di kawasan buku pesanan, anda boleh memerhati setiap urus niaga, perkadaran pembeli dan penjual, dan banyak lagi.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20231104093947118tJPSeGzaAQzu5N.png)


## 3. Istilah di kawasan perdagangan
Buka dan Tutup: Selepas memasukkan harga dan kuantiti berdasarkan penghakiman anda terhadap arah pasaran, anda boleh memilih untuk membuka kedudukan panjang atau pendek. Jika anda meramalkan peningkatan harga, anda membuka kedudukan panjang; jika anda meramalkan penurunan, anda membuka kedudukan pendek. Apabila anda menjual kontrak yang anda beli, anda menutup kedudukan. Apabila anda membuka kedudukan dengan membeli kontrak dan memegangnya tanpa penyelesaian, ia dipanggil kedudukan pegangan. Anda boleh melihat kedudukan pegangan anda dengan mengklik pada [Kedudukan Terbuka] di bahagian bawah halaman.

Buka Panjang: Apabila anda meramalkan harga token akan meningkat pada masa hadapan dan membuka kedudukan berdasarkan trend ini, ia dikenali sebagai membuka kedudukan panjang.

Buka Pendek: Apabila anda meramalkan harga token akan jatuh pada masa hadapan dan membuka kedudukan berdasarkan trend ini, ia dikenali sebagai membuka kedudukan pendek.

Margin dan Mod Margin: Pengguna boleh terlibat dalam niaga hadapan selepas mendepositkan peratusan dana tertentu sebagai cagaran kewangan. Dana ini dikenali sebagai margin. Mod margin dibahagikan kepada margin terasing atau margin silang.

Terasing: Dalam mod margin terasing, sejumlah margin tertentu diperuntukkan kepada satu kedudukan. Jika margin untuk satu kedudukan berkurangan kepada paras di bawah margin penyelenggaraan, kedudukan itu akan dihapuskan. Anda juga boleh memilih untuk menambah atau mengurangkan margin kepada kedudukan ini.

Silang: Dalam mod margin silang, semua kedudukan berkongsi margin silang aset tersebut. Sekiranya berlaku penghapusan, peniaga mungkin kehilangan semua margin dan semua kedudukan di bawah margin silang aset tersebut.

Jenis Pesanan: Jenis pesanan dibahagikan kepada pesanan had, pesanan pasaran, pesanan pencetus, pesanan hentian seretan, dan pesanan hanya pasca.

Had: Pesanan had ialah pesanan yang diletakkan untuk membeli atau menjual pada harga tertentu atau lebih baik. Walau bagaimanapun, pelaksanaan pesanan had tidak dijamin.

Pasaran: Pesanan pasaran ialah pesanan yang diletakkan untuk membeli atau menjual dengan cepat pada harga terbaik yang tersedia di pasaran.

Pencetus: Bagi pesanan pencetus, pengguna boleh menetapkan harga pencetus, harga pesanan, dan kuantiti terlebih dahulu. Apabila harga pasaran mencapai harga pencetus, sistem akan secara automatik meletakkan pesanan pada harga pesanan. Sebelum pesanan pencetus dicetuskan dengan jayanya, kedudukan atau margin tidak akan dibekukan.

Hentian Seretan: Pesanan hentian seretan dihantar ke pasaran berdasarkan tetapan pengguna sebagai pesanan strategik apabila pasaran berada dalam pembetulan. Harga Pencetus Sebenar = Harga Tertinggi (Terendah) Pasaran ± Varians Jejak (Jarak Harga), atau Harga Tertinggi (Terendah) Pasaran * (1 ± Varians Jejak). Pada masa yang sama, pengguna boleh menetapkan harga di mana pesanan diaktifkan sebelum harga pencetus dikira.

Hanya Pasca: Pesanan hanya pasca tidak akan serta-merta dilaksanakan di pasaran, memastikan pengguna sentiasa menjadi pembuat. Sekiranya pesanan itu dipadankan dengan pesanan sedia ada dengan serta-merta, ia akan dibatalkan.

TP/SL: Pesanan TP/SL ialah pesanan dengan syarat pencetus yang telah ditetapkan (harga untung atau harga henti rugi). Apabila harga terakhir / harga adil / harga indeks mencapai harga pencetus yang telah ditetapkan, sistem akan menutup kedudukan pada harga pasaran terbaik, berdasarkan harga dan kuantiti pencetus yang telah ditetapkan. Ini dilakukan untuk mencapai matlamat mengambil untung atau menghentikan kerugian, membenarkan pengguna untuk secara automatik menyelesaikan keuntungan yang diingini atau mengelakkan kerugian yang tidak perlu.

Pesanan Had Henti: Pesanan had henti ialah pesanan yang telah ditetapkan di mana pengguna boleh menetapkan harga henti rugi, harga had, dan jumlah beli/jual terlebih dahulu. Apabila harga terakhir mencapai harga henti rugi, sistem akan secara automatik meletakkan pesanan pada harga had.

COIN-M: Niaga hadapan bermargin duit syiling yang disediakan oleh MEXC ialah kontrak songsang yang menggunakan mata wang kripto sebagai cagaran, bermakna mata wang kripto berfungsi sebagai mata wang asas. Sebagai contoh, dalam kes niaga hadapan bermargin duit syiling BTC, Bitcoin digunakan sebagai margin awal dan untuk pengiraan PNL.

USDT-M: Niaga hadapan bermargin USDT yang disediakan oleh MEXC ialah kontrak linear, iaitu produk derivatif linear yang disebut dan diselesaikan dalam USDT, stablecoin yang dipatok kepada nilai dolar AS.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240207130411037xJqFxZAdTeGKQA.png)


## 4. Istilah di Kawasan Kalkulator Niaga Hadapan
PNL: Masukkan harga kemasukan anda, kuantiti niaga hadapan yang anda pegang, dan pengganda leverage. Kemudian, tetapkan harga penutup yang andajangka untuk mengira pendapatan dan hasil akhir.

Harga Sasaran: Masukkan harga kemasukan anda, kuantiti niaga hadapan yang anda pegang, dan pengganda leverage. Kemudian, tetapkan hasil yang anda inginkan untuk mengira pendapatan dan hasil akhir.

Harga Penghapusan: Masukkan harga kemasukan anda, kuantiti niaga hadapan yang anda pegang, dan pengganda leverage. Kemudian, pilih mod margin (silang atau terasing) untuk mengira harga penghapusan anda.

Buka Maks: Masukkan harga kemasukan anda, pengganda leverage, dan jumlah margin yang tersedia untuk mengira jumlah maksimum kontrak yang boleh anda buka untuk kedudukan panjang/pendek.

Harga Kemasukan: Apabila anda mempunyai pelbagai kedudukan niaga hadapan untuk pasangan perdagangan yang sama, masukkan harga kemasukan masing-masing dan kuantiti niaga hadapan yang sepadan. Anda boleh mengira harga kemasukan purata untuk kontrak pasangan perdagangan yang sama.

Yuran Pembiayaan: Masukkan harga adil, kuantiti kedudukan, dan kadar pembiayaan (0.01%) untuk mengira jumlah yuran pembiayaan yang perlu anda bayar atau terima.

Nota: Keputusan yang dikira menggunakan kalkulator niaga hadapan adalah untuk tujuan rujukan sahaja, dan keputusan sebenar dalam perdagangan langsung akan mengatasi.

## 5.1 Kedudukan Terbuka
Kedudukan: Bilangan kontrak dalam kedudukan yang belum ditutup.

Harga Kemasukan Purata: Harga kos purata apabila pengguna membuka kedudukan. Contohnya, jika pengguna membuka kedudukan panjang 100 kontrak dalam niaga hadapan perpetual MX/USDT pada 2 USDT dan kemudian membuka satu lagi kedudukan 100 kontrak dalam arah yang sama pada 2.1 USDT, harga kemasukan purata pengguna akan dikira seperti berikut: (2 * 100 + 2.1 * 100) / (100 + 100) = 2.05 USDT.

Harga Adil: Mekanisme ini diperkenalkan untuk melindungi pengguna daripada kerugian akibat turun naik pasaran yang luar biasa pada satu platform. Ia dikira dengan menimbang data harga daripada bursa aliran utama, memberikan gambaran yang adil tentang harga pasaran sebenar. Untuk maklumat lanjut tentang harga adil, anda boleh merujuk kepada artikel "Harga Indeks, Harga Adil dan Harga Terakhir."

Harga Liq. Anggaran: Apabila harga adil mencapai harga penghapusan yang dianggarkan, kedudukan anda akan mengalami penghapusan paksa. Untuk maklumat lanjut mengenai penghapusan paksa, anda boleh merujuk kepada artikel "Penghapusan Paksa."

Apabila pengguna meletakkan pesanan yang besar, pesanan itu biasanya dibahagikan kepada beberapa pesanan yang lebih kecil, yang dipenuhi secara berurutan. "Jumlah Terisi" merujuk kepada kuantiti sebenar yang telah didagangkan. Apabila jumlah pesanan sama dengan jumlah terisi, ia bermakna pesanan telah diisi sepenuhnya.

Harga Pesanan dan Harga Terisi: "Harga Pesanan" merujuk kepada harga dagangan yang dikehendaki yang dimasukkan oleh pengguna semasa meletakkan pesanan. Jika pengguna memilih pesanan had, harga pesanan ialah harga yang dimasukkan oleh pengguna. Jika pengguna memilih pesanan pasaran, harga pesanan bergantung kepada keputusan dagangan sebenar. Apabila pengguna meletakkan pesanan yang besar, pesanan itu biasanya dibahagikan kepada beberapa pesanan yang lebih kecil, yang dipenuhi secara berurutan. Disebabkan turun naik pasaran, harga terisi sebenar setiap pesanan mungkin berbeza. "Harga Terisi" merujuk kepada purata harga terisi sebenar ini.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F202311040939474303sGRvBR8a4lLae.png)

Harga Kemasukan Purata: Kos purata untuk membuka kedudukan.

PNL Terrealisasi: Semua keuntungan dan kerugian yang direalisasikan yang dijana oleh kedudukan, termasuk yuran perdagangan, kos pembiayaan, dan PNL penutupan. (Tidak termasuk bahagian yuran perdagangan yang diimbangi menggunakan kupon dan MX.)

Futures trading beginners may find themselves unfamiliar with these professional terms and their meanings when trading on the MEXC futures page. On the MEXC futures trading page, relevant information for each trading pair is provided.  Let's take the USDT-M perpetual futures trading pair, BTC/USDT, as an example.

Click on the MEXC homepage and select [Futures] from the navigation bar - [USDT-M Futures] to enter the USDT-M futures page.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20241204103818844ZmHXIELHOz5S1f.png]
Search and select the BTC/USDT trading pair, click on [Trading Rules] - [View all futures trading rules] to enter the futures information page.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240501101641800qpqPCE7ScMw0YO.png]
Select the first tab, [Futures Details]. This page displays detailed futures information for the BTC/USDT trading pair. You can also use the dropdown menu to select other trading pairs and view the relevant futures details.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240901121238034ITzpUEcL2k0sK9.png]


## Definitions of Terms on the Details Page


## 1. Futures Basic Information
Perpetual Futures:Perpetual futures, also known as perpetual futures contracts, evolved from traditional financial futures contracts, with the key difference being that perpetual futures have no settlement date. This means that as long as the position is not closed due to forced liquidation, it will remain open indefinitely.

Index Price:The comprehensive price index obtained by referencing the prices on major mainstream exchanges and calculating the weighted average of their prices. The index price displayed on the current page is the BTC index price. The index price for BTC is obtained by referencing the prices on BYBIT, HUOBI, and MEXC.

Fair Price:The real-time fair price of the futures, calculated based on the index price and market price. It is used to calculate the floating PNL of positions and determine position liquidation. It may deviate from the last price of the futures to avoid price manipulation.

Size (1 Cont):This represents the value of one contract for the futures. For USDT-M futures, each contract is measured in the quantity of the token. For Coin-M futures, each contract is measured in US dollars. For example, the futures size for BTCis 1 contract = 0.0001 BTC.

Minimum Price Change:The minimum price fluctuation per contract for the futures. For example, the minimum price change of BTC is 0.1.

Minimum Order Amount:The minimum order quantity for a single order for the futures. For example, the minimum trading amount for BTC is 0.0001 BTC.

Limit Order Price Cap / Price Floor Ratio:The buy limit order price should be lower than or equal to (1 + Price Cap Ratio) * Index Price. The sell limit order price should be higher than or equal to (1 - Price Floor Ratio) * Index Price.

Maximum Open Order Quantity:Maximum number of open limit orders for each trading pair.

Price Protection:After enabling the price protection feature, if the TP/SL (trigger order) reaches the trigger price, and if the price difference between the last price and the fair price of the futures exceeds the set threshold for that futures, the TP/SL (trigger order) will be rejected. Please note that price protection will only take effect once enabled and will not apply to historical orders that were placed before it was enabled.



## 2. Margins
Initial Margin:The minimum required margin amount for opening a position.

Initial Margin Rate:The value of the position at the time of opening the position divided by the position margin. The initial margin rate corresponds to your leverage multiplier.

Maintenance Margin:The minimum required margin to maintain a position. When the margin balance of a position falls below the maintenance margin, the position will be liquidated or reduced. Maintenance Margin = Position Nominal Value * Maintenance Margin Rate.

Maintenance Margin Rate:The maintenance margin rate is calculated based on the user's position size and is not affected by the leverage multiplier.

Risk Limit:MEXC implements a risk limit mechanism for all trading accounts, utilizing a tiered margin model to manage risk. The leverage multiplier is determined based on the position size, with lower leverage multipliers available for larger positions. Users can adjust the leverage multiplier themselves, and the initial margin rate is calculated based on the user's chosen leverage multiplier.

Value-added Risk Limit:Perpetual futures for different tokens correspond to different risk limits and incremental limit tiers. For example, the risk limit of ZK perpetual futures is divided into 5 tiers.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240901121237717B29DWKWuX18Ubz.png]




## 3. Fees
Funding Rate:Based on the price difference between the perpetual futures market price and the spot market price, funding fees are periodically exchanged between long and short traders. When the market is bullish, the funding rate is positive, and long traders in perpetual futures trading will pay funding fees to short traders. Conversely, when the market is bearish, the funding rate is negative, and short traders in perpetual futures trading will pay funding fees to long traders.

Note: Funding rates fluctuate based on the market sentiment, and the funding rates may vary for different trading pairs. For detailed information, please refer to theLatest Funding Rates.

Billing Cycle:Generally,the funding fees for all perpetual futures on MEXC are calculated every 8 hours.

Unrealized PNL:The PNL of the long/short position displayed before closing the position.

Long: Quantity (cont) * Futures Size (cont) * (Fair Price - Average Entry Price)

Short: Quantity (cont) * Futures Size (cont) * (Average Entry Price - Fair Price)

PNL:The PNL of the long/short position displayed after closing the position.

Long: Quantity (cont) * Futures Size (cont) * (Average Close Price - Average Entry Price)

Short: Quantity (cont) * Futures Size (cont) * (Average Entry Price - Average Close Price)

Liquidity Maker:This refers to traders who place orders that are not immediately matched with existing orders but are left on the order book, providing liquidity to the market.

Trading Fee for Liquidity Maker:The fee rate charged to liquidity makers.The maker fee rate on the MEXC platform is 0%.

Liquidity Taker:This refers to traders who place orders that are immediately matched with existing orders, consuming liquidity from the market.

Trading Fee for Liquidity Taker:The fee rate charged to liquidity takers. In the MEXC perpetual futures market, the taker fee rate is 0.02%.

Forced Liquidation Trading Fee:When a user's position is liquidated, MEXC charges a certain percentage as a liquidation fee. For example, the liquidation fee rate for BTC perpetual futures is 0.02%.



## 4. Others
Automatic Deleveraging (ADL):When a trader’s position is liquidated, their remaining positions are taken over by MEXC's perpetual futures liquidation system. If the liquidated positions cannot be closed in the market and when the mark price reaches the bankruptcy price, the automatic deleveraging system will reduce the positions of traders holding positions in the opposite direction. The order of deleveraging is determined based on the leverage and profit ratio.

## Definisi Istilah pada Halaman Butiran


## 1. Maklumat Asas Futures
Futures Kekal: Futures kekal, juga dikenali sebagai kontrak futures kekal, berkembang daripada kontrak futures kewangan tradisional, dengan perbezaan utama ialah futures kekal tidak mempunyai tarikh penyelesaian. Ini bermakna selagi kedudukan tidak ditutup disebabkan oleh pengagihan paksa, ia akan kekal terbuka tanpa had.

Harga Indeks: Indeks harga komprehensif yang diperoleh dengan merujuk kepada harga di bursa aliran utama utama dan mengira purata wajaran harga mereka. Harga indeks yang dipaparkan pada halaman semasa ialah harga indeks BTC. Harga indeks untuk BTC diperolehi dengan merujuk kepada harga di BYBIT, HUOBI, dan MEXC.

Harga Adil: Harga adil masa nyata futures, dikira berdasarkan harga indeks dan harga pasaran. Ia digunakan untuk mengira PNL terapung kedudukan dan menentukan pengagihan kedudukan. Ia mungkin menyimpang daripada harga terakhir futures untuk mengelakkan manipulasi harga.

Saiz (1 Kontrak): Ini mewakili nilai satu kontrak untuk futures. Bagi futures USDT-M, setiap kontrak diukur dalam kuantiti token. Bagi futures Coin-M, setiap kontrak diukur dalam dolar AS. Sebagai contoh, saiz futures untuk BTC ialah 1 kontrak = 0.0001 BTC.

Perubahan Harga Minimum: Pergerakan harga minimum setiap kontrak untuk futures. Sebagai contoh, perubahan harga minimum BTC ialah 0.1.

Amaun Pesanan Minimum: Kuantiti pesanan minimum untuk satu pesanan untuk futures. Sebagai contoh, amaun dagangan minimum untuk BTC ialah 0.0001 BTC.

Had Harga Pesanan Had/Nisbah Lantai Harga: Harga pesanan had beli perlu lebih rendah daripada atau sama dengan (1 + Nisbah Had Harga) * Harga Indeks. Harga pesanan had jual perlu lebih tinggi daripada atau sama dengan (1 - Nisbah Lantai Harga) * Harga Indeks.

Kuantiti Pesanan Terbuka Maksimum: Bilangan pesanan had terbuka maksimum untuk setiap pasangan dagangan.

Perlindungan Harga: Selepas mendayakan ciri perlindungan harga, jika TP/SL (pesanan pencetus) mencapai harga pencetus, dan jika perbezaan harga antara harga terakhir dan harga adil futures melebihi ambang yang ditetapkan untuk futures tersebut, TP/SL (pesanan pencetus) akan ditolak. Sila ambil perhatian bahawa perlindungan harga hanya akan berkuat kuasa sebaik sahaja didayakan dan tidak akan dikenakan kepada pesanan sejarah yang diletakkan sebelum ia didayakan.



## 2. Margin
Margin Awal: Amaun margin minimum yang diperlukan untuk membuka kedudukan.

Kadar Margin Awal: Nilai kedudukan pada masa membuka kedudukan dibahagikan dengan margin kedudukan. Kadar margin awal sepadan dengan pengganda leverage anda.

Margin Penyelenggaraan: Margin minimum yang diperlukan untuk mengekalkan kedudukan. Apabila baki margin kedudukan jatuh di bawah margin penyelenggaraan, kedudukan akan diagihkan atau dikurangkan. Margin Penyelenggaraan = Nilai Nominal Kedudukan * Kadar Margin Penyelenggaraan.

Kadar Margin Penyelenggaraan: Kadar margin penyelenggaraan dikira berdasarkan saiz kedudukan pengguna dan tidak terjejas oleh pengganda leverage.

Had Risiko: MEXC melaksanakan mekanisme had risiko untuk semua akaun dagangan, menggunakan model margin berperingkat untuk menguruskan risiko. Pengganda leverage ditentukan berdasarkan saiz kedudukan, dengan pengganda leverage yang lebih rendah tersedia untuk kedudukan yang lebih besar. Pengguna boleh menyesuaikan pengganda leverage sendiri, dan kadar margin awal dikira berdasarkan pengganda leverage yang dipilih oleh pengguna.

Had Risiko Nilai Tambah: Futures kekal untuk token yang berbeza sepadan dengan had risiko dan peringkat had tambahan yang berbeza. Sebagai contoh, had risiko futures ZK dibahagikan kepada 5 peringkat.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240901121237717B29DWKWuX18Ubz.png)




## 3. Yuran
Kadar Pendanaan: Berdasarkan perbezaan harga antara harga pasaran futures kekal dan harga pasaran spot, yuran pendanaan ditukar secara berkala antara pedagang panjang dan pendek. Apabila pasaran lembu jantan, kadar pendanaan adalah positif, dan pedagang panjang dalam dagangan futures kekal akan membayar yuran pendanaan kepada pedagang pendek. Sebaliknya, apabila pasaran menurun, kadar pendanaan adalah negatif, dan pedagang pendek dalam dagangan futures kekal akan membayar yuran pendanaan kepada pedagang panjang.

Nota: Kadar pendanaan berfluktuasi berdasarkan sentimen pasaran, dan kadar pendanaan mungkin berbeza untuk pasangan dagangan yang berbeza. Untuk maklumat terperinci, sila rujuk kepada Kadar Pendanaan Terkini.

Kitaran Bil: Secara umumnya, yuran pendanaan untuk semua futures kekal di MEXC dikira setiap 8 jam.

PNL Tidak Direalisasikan: PNL kedudukan panjang/pendek yang dipaparkan sebelum menutup kedudukan.

Panjang: Kuantiti (kontrak) * Saiz Futures (kontrak) * (Harga Adil - Harga Kemasukan Purata)

Pendek: Kuantiti (kontrak) * Saiz Futures (kontrak) * (Harga Kemasukan Purata - Harga Adil)

PNL: PNL kedudukan panjang/pendek yang dipaparkan selepas menutup kedudukan.

Panjang: Kuantiti (kontrak) * Saiz Futures (kontrak) * (Harga Penutupan Purata - Harga Kemasukan Purata)

Pendek: Kuantiti (kontrak) * Saiz Futures (kontrak) * (Harga Kemasukan Purata - Harga Penutupan Purata)

Pembuat Cecair: Ini merujuk kepada pedagang yang meletakkan pesanan yang tidak serta-merta dipadankan dengan pesanan sedia ada tetapi ditinggalkan pada buku pesanan, menyediakan kecairan kepada pasaran.

Yuran Dagangan untuk Pembuat Cecair: Kadar yuran yang dikenakan kepada pembuat cecair. Kadar yuran pembuat pada platform MEXC ialah 0%.

Pengambil Cecair: Ini merujuk kepada pedagang yang meletakkan pesanan yang serta-merta dipadankan dengan pesanan sedia ada, menggunakan kecairan daripada pasaran.

Yuran Dagangan untuk Pengambil Cecair: Kadar yuran yang dikenakan kepada pengambil cecair. Dalam pasaran futures kekal MEXC, kadar yuran pengambil ialah 0.02%.

Yuran Dagangan Pengagihan Paksa: Apabila kedudukan pengguna diagihkan, MEXC mengenakan peratusan tertentu sebagai yuran pengagihan. Sebagai contoh, kadar yuran pengagihan untuk futures kekal BTC ialah 0.02%.



## 4. Lain-lain
Pelepasan Leveraj Automatik (ADL): Apabila kedudukan pedagang diagihkan, kedudukan mereka yang tinggal diambil alih oleh sistem pengagihan futures kekal MEXC. Sekiranya kedudukan yang diagihkan tidak dapat ditutup di pasaran dan apabila harga tanda mencapai harga muflis, sistem pelepasan leveraj automatik akan mengurangkan kedudukan pedagang yang memegang kedudukan dalam arah yang bertentangan. Susunan pelepasan leveraj ditentukan berdasarkan nisbah leveraj dan keuntungan.



Memahami istilah yang berkaitan dengan dagangan futures hanyalah langkah pertama dalam mempelajari cara menggunakan alat futures. Seterusnya, anda perlu mendapatkan pengalaman praktikal melalui dagangan. Sebelum berdagang futures, anda boleh berlatih menggunakan platform Dagangan Demo futures yang disediakan oleh MEXC. Sebaik sahaja anda mahir, anda boleh beralih kepada dagangan futures secara langsung.Penafian: Maklumat ini tidak memberikan nasihat tentang pelaburan, cukai, undang-undang, kewangan, perakaunan, atau sebarang perkhidmatan berkaitan yang lain, mahupun ia merupakan nasihat untuk membeli, menjual, atau memegang sebarang aset. MEXC Learn menyediakan maklumat untuk tujuan rujukan sahaja dan tidak merupakan nasihat pelaburan. Pastikan anda memahami sepenuhnya risiko yang terlibat dan berhati-hati semasa melabur. ## 1. USDT-M Futures vs Coin-M Futures
USDT-M futures, also known as linear futures, are contracts denominated in stablecoins such as USDT and USDC. MEXC's USDT-M futures are both quoted and settled in USDT. The main advantage of USDT-M futures lies in the straightforward calculation of returns in fiat currency, which enhances the intuitive nature of profit assessments.

Coin-M futures, also known as inverse futures, are settled in their respective cryptocurrencies (e.g., BTC, ETH, and XRP), without requiring stablecoins as margin. Currently, MEXC offers BTC and ETH Coin-M futures. The main advantage of Coin-M futures is the optimization of capital utilization—allowing traders to engage in futures trading while maintaining holdings in cryptocurrencies.
