## 2. How to Set Up USDT-M or Coin-M Futures
On MEXC, you can choose from hundreds of USDT-M futures and two types of Coin-M futures: BTC-margined and ETH-margined futures.



## 2.1 Web
On the MEXC website, you can choose USDT-M or Coin-M futures in two ways:

1) In the top navigation bar, click [Futures] and select either [USDT-M Perpetual Futures] or [Coin-M Perpetual Futures] to access the corresponding trading page.

2) If you are already on the futures trading page, click the [▼] button next to the trading pair and select either [USDT-M] or [COIN-M] from the dropdown menu.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240706222221572qvJPt39qgfXxqX.png]


## 2.2 App
Open the MEXC App, tap the [Futures] button at the bottom of the screen. Then, at the top of the futures trading page, you can select either [USDT-M] or [COIN-M].


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240706222220639yZr8bS6MKLeMek.png]


## 3. How to Choose Between USDT-M and Coin-M Futures


## 3.1 Reasons to Choose Coin-M Futures
Holders of crypto assets can hedge and trade in the MEXC Coin-M futures market without converting their assets to USDT. In other words, users do not need to sell any crypto at a low price.

During a bull market, investors prefer to keep holding their crypto assets. Since Coin-M futures are settled in cryptocurrencies, any profits generated are directly converted into long-term crypto holdings. This is an excellent way for users to accumulate more crypto over time.



## 3.2 Reasons to Choose USDT-M Futures
If you primarily hold USDT and do not own other crypto assets, USDT-M futures might be more suitable for you. MEXC's USDT-M futures market offers hundreds of trading pairs with up to 400x leverage, providing numerous opportunities to earn profits.

Both USDT-M futures and Coin-M futures have their unique advantages. You can choose the one that best fits your needs and trade accordingly on MEXC's futures market.

## 1. What is the Funding Rate?
The funding rate is the price difference between the perpetual futures market price and the spot price, and it involves regular exchanges of funding fees between long and short traders. When the market is trending upward and the funding rate is positive, long traders of perpetual futures will pay funding fees to short traders. Conversely, when the market is trending downward and the funding rate is negative, short traders of perpetual futures will pay funding fees to long traders.



## 2. Why is the Funding Rate Mechanism Necessary?
The primary purpose of the funding rate mechanism is to allow the market to self-regulate by facilitating the regular exchange of funding fees between long and short traders, thereby anchoring the perpetual futures market price to the spot price.

Perpetual futures do not have an expiration date and can be held indefinitely as long as they are not liquidated. This makes perpetual futures trading similar to spot trading. However, in order to ensure that the perpetual futures market price stays close to the spot price, a mechanism is required to anchor the price, which is where the funding rate mechanism comes into play.



## 3. How is the Funding Rate Calculated?


## 3.1 USDT-M Perpetual Contracts Funding Rate Calculation:
Funding Fee = Position Value x Funding Rate

Position Value = Quantity Held (in tokens) x Fair Price

Example: Trader A holds a long position of 10 BTC in BTC/USDT perpetual futures, and the current fair price is 10,000 USDT. The current funding rate is 0.01%.

Current Position Value = 10 x 10,000 = 100,000 USDT

Funding Fee = 100,000 x 0.01% = 10 USDT

Since the funding rate is positive (0.01%), the long position holders must pay this fee to the short position holders. Therefore, Trader A needs to pay 10 USDT as the funding fee, while the short position holder with an equal futures quantity will receive 10 USDT as the funding fee.



## 3.2 Coin-M Perpetual Futures Funding Rate Calculation:
Position Value = Quantity Held (in cont.) x Contract Size / Fair Price

Example: Trader A holds a long position of 100 contracts in BTC/USD perpetual futures. The size of 1 contract of BTC/USD is 100 USD, and the current fair price is 10,000 USDT. The current funding rate is 0.01%.

Position Value = 100 * 100 / 10,000 = 1 BTC

Funding Fee = 1 BTC x 0.01% = 0.0001 BTC

Since the funding fee is positive (0.01%), the long position holders must pay this fee to the short position holders. Therefore, Trader A needs to pay 0.0001 BTC as the funding fee, while the short position holder with an equal futures quantity will receive 0.0001 BTC as the funding fee.



## 4. How to Check the Funding Rate
On the futures trading page, you can view the current upcoming funding rate above the K-line chart. The countdown indicates the time remaining until the settlement period.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20241019110011760JDzYW9htkauxOc.png]
Note: The funding rates for different trading pairs may vary. Users need to check the funding rate based on their selected trading pair.

In the upper right corner of the Futures Orders section, select [Funding Fees] to view all the past funding fees that have been settled.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20241019110011770g9yYcIF7b68Gdf.png]


## 5. Funding Fee Settlement Period
MEXC does not charge any funding fees to users. Instead, funding fees are collected between position-holding users.

Under normal circumstances, MEXC perpetual futures funding fees are settled every 8 hours, respectively at 00:00 UTC, 08:00 UTC, and 16:00 UTC. For more information about the adjustment of funding fee settlement frequency, please visit the Help Center page and check the Futures Announcements.

Traders are only required to pay or receive funding fees if they hold positions at the funding fee settlement time. If you close your position before the funding fee settlement time, you will not incur any funding fees.

If the funding rate is positive, long positions will pay funding fees to short positions. Conversely, if the funding rate is negative, short positions will pay funding fees to long positions.

The funding fees paid by traders will be deducted from their available margin. When a trader does not have sufficient available margin, the funding fee will be deducted from the position margin. In this case, the liquidation price will gradually approach the fair price due to the deduction of funding fees, thus increasing the risk of liquidation.

In the cryptocurrency futures market, the funding rate plays a crucial role, ensuring that the price difference between the futures and spot market stays within equilibrium, allowing prices to return to normal levels. Overall, this serves to restrict malicious manipulation of futures prices. In the short term, funding rates are explicit indicators of market liquidity and activity, indicating investors' willingness to pay fees for leverage.

## 1. Apakah Kadar Pendanaan?
Kadar pendanaan ialah perbezaan harga antara harga pasaran niaga hadapan kekal dan harga spot, dan ia melibatkan pertukaran yuran pendanaan secara tetap antara pedagang panjang dan pendek. Apabila pasaran menuju ke atas dan kadar pendanaan adalah positif, pedagang panjang niaga hadapan kekal akan membayar yuran pendanaan kepada pedagang pendek. Sebaliknya, apabila pasaran menuju ke bawah dan kadar pendanaan adalah negatif, pedagang pendek niaga hadapan kekal akan membayar yuran pendanaan kepada pedagang panjang.



## 2. Mengapa Mekanisme Kadar Pendanaan Diperlukan?
Tujuan utama mekanisme kadar pendanaan ialah untuk membenarkan pasaran mengawal dirinya sendiri dengan memudahkan pertukaran yuran pendanaan secara tetap antara pedagang panjang dan pendek, dengan itu menambat harga pasaran niaga hadapan kekal kepada harga spot.

Niaga hadapan kekal tidak mempunyai tarikh luput dan boleh dipegang tanpa had selagi ia tidak dilikuidasi. Ini menjadikan perdagangan niaga hadapan kekal serupa dengan perdagangan spot. Walau bagaimanapun, untuk memastikan bahawa harga pasaran niaga hadapan kekal kekal hampir dengan harga spot, mekanisme diperlukan untuk menambat harga, iaitu di mana mekanisme kadar pendanaan memainkan peranan.



## 3. Bagaimana Kadar Pendanaan Dihitung?


## 3.1 Pengiraan Kadar Pendanaan Kontrak Kekal USDT-M:
Yuran Pendanaan = Nilai Posisi x Kadar Pendanaan

Nilai Posisi = Kuantiti Dipegang (dalam token) x Harga Adil

Contoh: Pedagang A memegang posisi panjang 10 BTC dalam niaga hadapan kekal BTC/USDT, dan harga adil semasa ialah 10,000 USDT. Kadar pendanaan semasa ialah 0.01%.

Nilai Posisi Semasa = 10 x 10,000 = 100,000 USDT

Yuran Pendanaan = 100,000 x 0.01% = 10 USDT

Oleh kerana kadar pendanaan adalah positif (0.01%), pemegang posisi panjang mesti membayar yuran ini kepada pemegang posisi pendek. Oleh itu, Pedagang A perlu membayar 10 USDT sebagai yuran pendanaan, manakala pemegang posisi pendek dengan kuantiti niaga hadapan yang sama akan menerima 10 USDT sebagai yuran pendanaan.



## 3.2 Pengiraan Kadar Pendanaan Niaga Hadapan Kekal Coin-M:
Nilai Posisi = Kuantiti Dipegang (dalam kont.) x Saiz Kontrak / Harga Adil

Contoh: Pedagang A memegang posisi panjang 100 kontrak dalam niaga hadapan kekal BTC/USD. Saiz 1 kontrak BTC/USD ialah 100 USD, dan harga adil semasa ialah 10,000 USDT. Kadar pendanaan semasa ialah 0.01%.

Nilai Posisi = 100 * 100 / 10,000 = 1 BTC

Yuran Pendanaan = 1 BTC x 0.01% = 0.0001 BTC

Oleh kerana yuran pendanaan adalah positif (0.01%), pemegang posisi panjang mesti membayar yuran ini kepada pemegang posisi pendek. Oleh itu, Pedagang A perlu membayar 0.0001 BTC sebagai yuran pendanaan, manakala pemegang posisi pendek dengan kuantiti niaga hadapan yang sama akan menerima 0.0001 BTC sebagai yuran pendanaan.



## 4. Cara Memeriksa Kadar Pendanaan
Di halaman perdagangan niaga hadapan, anda boleh melihat kadar pendanaan akan datang di atas carta K-line. Kiraan menurun menunjukkan masa yang tinggal sehingga tempoh penyelesaian.

Di penjuru kanan atas bahagian Pesanan Niaga Hadapan, pilih [Yuran Pendanaan] untuk melihat semua yuran pendanaan lepas yang telah diselesaikan.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20241019110011770g9yYcIF7b68Gdf.png)


## 5. Tempoh Penyelesaian Yuran Pendanaan
MEXC tidak mengenakan sebarang yuran pendanaan kepada pengguna. Sebaliknya, yuran pendanaan dikutip antara pengguna yang memegang posisi.

Dalam keadaan biasa, yuran pendanaan niaga hadapan kekal MEXC diselesaikan setiap 8 jam, masing-masing pada 00:00 UTC, 08:00 UTC, dan 16:00 UTC. Untuk maklumat lanjut mengenai pelarasan kekerapan penyelesaian yuran pendanaan, sila lawati halaman Pusat Bantuan dan semak Pengumuman Niaga Hadapan.

Pedagang hanya perlu membayar atau menerima yuran pendanaan jika mereka memegang posisi pada masa penyelesaian yuran pendanaan. Jika anda menutup posisi anda sebelum masa penyelesaian yuran pendanaan, anda tidak akan dikenakan sebarang yuran pendanaan.

Jika kadar pendanaan adalah positif, posisi panjang akan membayar yuran pendanaan kepada posisi pendek. Sebaliknya, jika kadar pendanaan adalah negatif, posisi pendek akan membayar yuran pendanaan kepada posisi panjang.

Yuran pendanaan yang dibayar oleh pedagang akan ditolak daripada margin yang ada. Apabila pedagang tidak mempunyai margin yang mencukupi, yuran pendanaan akan ditolak daripada margin posisi. Dalam kes ini, harga penghapusan akan secara beransur-ansur menghampiri harga adil disebabkan oleh potongan yuran pendanaan, dengan itu meningkatkan risiko penghapusan.

Dalam pasaran niaga hadapan kripto, kadar pendanaan memainkan peranan penting, memastikan bahawa perbezaan harga antara pasaran niaga hadapan dan pasaran spot kekal dalam keseimbangan, membenarkan harga kembali ke tahap normal. Secara keseluruhannya, ini berfungsi untuk mengehadkan manipulasi harga niaga hadapan yang jahat. Dalam jangka pendek, kadar pendanaan adalah petunjuk eksplisit tentang kecairan dan aktiviti pasaran, menunjukkan kesediaan pelabur untuk membayar yuran untuk leverage.

## 1. What is Forced Liquidation?
Forced liquidation occurs when your margin reaches the maintenance margin level, leading to the need for your position to be liquidated, resulting in the loss of all your maintenance margin. When the fair price reaches the liquidation price, forced liquidation is triggered, a process generally referred to as "liquidation."

Forced liquidation typically occurs in futures trading during periods of high market volatility. When asset prices fluctuate significantly, traders' account balances may not meet the maintenance margin requirements. To address this situation, trading platforms automatically initiate forced liquidation according to predetermined rules.

For example, if a user engages in leveraged trading to purchase a certain value of crypto assets but experiences a price drop leading to insufficient margin, the trading platform will automatically sell a portion or all of the position to cover the margin shortfall.

MEXC employs a fair price marking system to prevent forced liquidation resulting from insufficient liquidity or market manipulation.



## 2. How is Forced Liquidation Carried Out?


## 2.1 Calculation of Liquidation Price in Isolated Margin Mode
Liquidation Condition:Position Margin + Floating PNL ≤ Maintenance Margin

Long Position:Liquidation Price = (Maintenance Margin - Position Margin + Average Entry Price x Quantity x Size) / (Quantity x Size)

Short Position:Liquidation Price = (Average Entry Price x Quantity x Size - Maintenance Margin + Position Margin) / (Quantity x Size)

Note: Trading fees are omitted here.



## 2.2 Forced Liquidation in Cross Margin Mode
In cross margin mode, all of the user's available margin will be used as the position margin. However, it is important to note that in cross margin mode, the unrealized PNL of profitable positions cannot be used as margin for other positions.

From the above formulas, we can see that users can increase the distance from the entry price by manually increasing the position margin. Therefore, users facing a higher risk of liquidation can mitigate it by manually increasing their margin.



## 3. Forced Liquidation Process
When forced liquidation is triggered, the system will proceed in the following order: executing order cancellations, self-trading between long and short positions, tiered liquidation, and then liquidation. This approach enables gradual liquidation based on user risk limits, avoiding full liquidation of all positions and mitigating risk for users.

3.1 Execution of order cancellation:In cross margin mode, all current orders in the account will be canceled. While in isolated margin mode, if automatic margin addition is enabled, all current orders for the futures pair will be canceled. After executing the order cancellation, if the margin ratio is still greater than or equal to 100%, the process continues to the next step.

3.2 Self-trading between long and short positions:Simultaneous cross margin positions in both long and short directions will be reduced by undergoing self-trading (this step is only applicable during the forced liquidation process in cross margin mode). After executing self-trading, if the margin ratio is still greater than or equal to 100%, the process continues to the next step.

3.3 Tiered liquidation: If the user's position is at the lowest risk limit tier, the process proceeds directly to the next step. If the risk limit tier of the user's position is higher than Tier 1, it needs to be lowered. This means a portion of the position at the current tier will be taken over by the liquidation engine at the bankruptcy price, reducing the risk limit tier. Then, the margin ratio is recalculated based on the maintenance margin ratio after lowering. If the margin ratio is still greater than or equal to 100%, the process continues to further lower the risk tier until the lowest tier is reached.

3.4Liquidation:If the position is at the lowest tier but the margin ratio is greater than or equal to 100%, the remaining position will be taken over by the liquidation engine at the bankruptcy price. (The liquidation takeover process bypasses the matching system, thus the bankruptcy price will not appear in market trade records or K-line charts.)



## 4. Handling After Liquidation Engine Takes Over Position
When a user's position is taken over by the liquidation engine at the bankruptcy price, if the remaining position can be executed in the market at a more favorable price than the bankruptcy price, the remaining margin will be added to the insurance fund.

If the position cannot be executed at a more favorable price than the bankruptcy price, the loss from liquidation will be compensated by the insurance fund. If the insurance fund is insufficient to cover the loss, the auto deleveraging system will take over the liquidated position.



## 5. How to Avoid Forced Liquidation


## 5.1 Increase Margin or Decrease Leverage
You can mitigate the risk of forced liquidation by adding margin or lowering the leverage, which moves the liquidation price away from the market price.



## 5.2 Set Stop-Loss
Setting a stop-loss price is an effective way to avoid forced liquidation, helping limit losses and prevent orders from being liquidated.

It is important to note that TP/SL orders may fail due to factors such as extreme market volatility or insufficient available position for closure. If triggered successfully, a market order will be placed to close the position, but due to market fluctuations, the market order may not be executed immediately, resulting in deviation from the set price.



## 5.3 Set Liquidation Alert Notifications
In the preference settings on the futures trading page, enable liquidation alert notifications and set the margin ratio. MEXC will alert you when the margin ratio of a position reaches or exceeds the value you set, with a maximum of one alert every 30 minutes per position.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F202404121323566180KL8IbGFChYKUV.png]


## Summary
The use of leverage tools can help you achieve greater profits but also comes with corresponding risks. When engaging in futures trading, you can avoid forced liquidation by utilizing the tools provided by the platform and adopting rational trading strategies.

## 1. Apakah Liksidasi Paksa?
Liksidasi paksa berlaku apabila margin anda mencapai paras margin penyelenggaraan, menyebabkan kedudukan anda perlu diliksidasi, mengakibatkan kerugian semua margin penyelenggaraan anda. Apabila harga saksama mencapai harga liksidasi, liksidasi paksa dicetuskan, satu proses yang umumnya dirujuk sebagai "liksidasi."

Liksidasi paksa biasanya berlaku dalam dagangan niaga hadapan semasa tempoh turun naik pasaran yang tinggi. Apabila harga aset berfluktuasi secara signifikan, baki akaun peniaga mungkin tidak memenuhi keperluan margin penyelenggaraan. Untuk menangani situasi ini, platform dagangan secara automatik memulakan liksidasi paksa mengikut peraturan yang telah ditetapkan.

Sebagai contoh, jika pengguna terlibat dalam dagangan leverage untuk membeli aset kripto dengan nilai tertentu tetapi mengalami penurunan harga yang menyebabkan margin tidak mencukupi, platform dagangan akan secara automatik menjual sebahagian atau semua kedudukan untuk menampung kekurangan margin.

MEXC menggunakan sistem penanda harga saksama untuk mencegah liksidasi paksa yang disebabkan oleh kecairan yang tidak mencukupi atau manipulasi pasaran.



## 2. Bagaimanakah Liksidasi Paksa Dilaksanakan?


## 2.1 Pengiraan Harga Liksidasi dalam Mod Margin Terasing
Keadaan Liksidasi: Margin Kedudukan + PNL Terapung ≤ Margin Penyelenggaraan

Kedudukan Panjang: Harga Liksidasi = (Margin Penyelenggaraan - Margin Kedudukan + Harga Kemasukan Purata x Kuantiti x Saiz) / (Kuantiti x Saiz)

Kedudukan Pendek: Harga Liksidasi = (Harga Kemasukan Purata x Kuantiti x Saiz - Margin Penyelenggaraan + Margin Kedudukan) / (Kuantiti x Saiz)

Nota: Yuran dagangan diabaikan di sini.



## 2.2 Liksidasi Paksa dalam Mod Margin Silang
Dalam mod margin silang, semua margin yang ada pengguna akan digunakan sebagai margin kedudukan. Walau bagaimanapun, adalah penting untuk ambil perhatian bahawa dalam mod margin silang, PNL yang belum direalisasikan daripada kedudukan yang menguntungkan tidak boleh digunakan sebagai margin untuk kedudukan lain.

Daripada formula di atas, kita dapat lihat bahawa pengguna boleh meningkatkan jarak dari harga kemasukan dengan secara manual meningkatkan margin kedudukan. Oleh itu, pengguna yang menghadapi risiko liksidasi yang lebih tinggi boleh mengurangkannya dengan secara manual meningkatkan margin mereka.



## 3. Proses Liksidasi Paksa
Apabila liksidasi paksa dicetuskan, sistem akan diteruskan mengikut susunan berikut: melaksanakan pembatalan pesanan, perdagangan sendiri antara kedudukan panjang dan pendek, liksidasi berperingkat, dan kemudian liksidasi. Pendekatan ini membolehkan liksidasi secara berperingkat berdasarkan had risiko pengguna, mengelakkan liksidasi sepenuhnya semua kedudukan dan mengurangkan risiko untuk pengguna.

3.1 Pelaksanaan pembatalan pesanan: Dalam mod margin silang, semua pesanan semasa dalam akaun akan dibatalkan. Manakala dalam mod margin terasing, jika penambahan margin automatik diaktifkan, semua pesanan semasa untuk pasangan niaga hadapan akan dibatalkan. Selepas melaksanakan pembatalan pesanan, jika nisbah margin masih lebih besar daripada atau sama dengan 100%, proses diteruskan ke langkah seterusnya.

3.2 Perdagangan sendiri antara kedudukan panjang dan pendek: Kedudukan margin silang serentak dalam kedua-dua arah panjang dan pendek akan dikurangkan dengan menjalani perdagangan sendiri (langkah ini hanya terpakai semasa proses liksidasi paksa dalam mod margin silang). Selepas melaksanakan perdagangan sendiri, jika nisbah margin masih lebih besar daripada atau sama dengan 100%, proses diteruskan ke langkah seterusnya.

3.3 Liksidasi berperingkat: Jika kedudukan pengguna berada pada peringkat had risiko terendah, proses diteruskan terus ke langkah seterusnya. Jika peringkat had risiko kedudukan pengguna lebih tinggi daripada Tahap 1, ia perlu diturunkan. Ini bermakna sebahagian daripada kedudukan pada peringkat semasa akan diambil alih oleh enjin liksidasi pada harga muflis, mengurangkan peringkat had risiko. Kemudian, nisbah margin dikira semula berdasarkan nisbah margin penyelenggaraan selepas diturunkan. Jika nisbah margin masih lebih besar daripada atau sama dengan 100%, proses diteruskan untuk menurunkan tahap risiko sehingga tahap terendah dicapai.

3.4 Liksidasi: Jika kedudukan berada pada tahap terendah tetapi nisbah margin lebih besar daripada atau sama dengan 100%, kedudukan yang tinggal akan diambil alih oleh enjin liksidasi pada harga muflis. (Proses pengambilalihan liksidasi melangkau sistem padanan, oleh itu harga muflis tidak akan muncul dalam rekod perdagangan pasaran atau carta K-line.)



## 4. Pengurusan Selepas Enjin Liksidasi Mengambil Alih Kedudukan
Apabila kedudukan pengguna diambil alih oleh enjin liksidasi pada harga muflis, jika kedudukan yang tinggal boleh dilaksanakan di pasaran pada harga yang lebih baik daripada harga muflis, margin yang tinggal akan ditambah kepada dana insurans.

Jika kedudukan tidak boleh dilaksanakan pada harga yang lebih baik daripada harga muflis, kerugian daripada liksidasi akan dibayar ganti oleh dana insurans. Jika dana insurans tidak mencukupi untuk menampung kerugian, sistem deleveraging automatik akan mengambil alih kedudukan yang diliksidasi.



## 5. Cara Mengelakkan Liksidasi Paksa


## 5.1 Meningkatkan Margin atau Mengurangkan Leverage
Anda boleh mengurangkan risiko liksidasi paksa dengan menambah margin atau menurunkan leverage, yang menggerakkan harga liksidasi jauh daripada harga pasaran.



## 5.2 Tetapkan Stop-Loss
Menetapkan harga stop-loss adalah cara yang berkesan untuk mengelakkan liksidasi paksa, membantu mengehadkan kerugian dan mencegah pesanan daripada diliksidasi.

Adalah penting untuk ambil perhatian bahawa pesanan TP/SL mungkin gagal disebabkan oleh faktor-faktor seperti turun naik pasaran yang melampau atau kedudukan yang ada tidak mencukupi untuk penutupan. Jika dicetuskan dengan jayanya, pesanan pasaran akan diletakkan untuk menutup kedudukan, tetapi disebabkan oleh turun naik pasaran, pesanan pasaran mungkin tidak dilaksanakan dengan serta-merta, mengakibatkan penyimpangan daripada harga yang ditetapkan.



## 5.3 Tetapkan Notifikasi Amaran Liksidasi
Dalam tetapan pilihan pada halaman dagangan niaga hadapan, aktifkan notifikasi amaran liksidasi dan tetapkan nisbah margin. MEXC akan memberi amaran kepada anda apabila nisbah margin kedudukan mencapai atau melebihi nilai yang anda tetapkan, dengan maksimum satu amaran setiap 30 minit bagi setiap kedudukan.

## Ringkasan
Penggunaan alat leverage dapat membantu anda mencapai keuntungan yang lebih besar tetapi juga disertai dengan risiko yang sepadan. Apabila terlibat dalam dagangan niaga hadapan, anda boleh mengelakkan liksidasi paksa dengan menggunakan alat yang disediakan oleh platform dan mengamalkan strategi dagangan yang rasional.

## 1. What is Auto-Margin Addition?
Auto margin addition is a feature provided by MEXC that allows traders to automatically add position margin to isolated margin positions they already hold, with the aim of avoiding liquidation. Once the auto margin addition feature is enabled, when your position is nearing liquidation, your available margin will automatically be transferred to the position to prevent liquidation from occurring.

The amount added each time through auto margin addition corresponds to the maintenance margin required for that position. After adding margin, the position will recalibrate to a more favorable liquidation price. During auto margin addition, the system will first cancel the user's open orders for that futures position.



## 2. How to Set Up Auto Margin Addition
The MEXC platform offers the auto margin addition feature, which automatically transfers available margin from your wallet into the position's margin when your isolated margin position is about to be auto-reduced or liquidated.

It's important to note that the auto margin addition feature reduces the likelihood of liquidation, but in extreme situations, it may result in a complete loss of assets in your futures account.

## 1. What is the Index Price?
The index price is the weighted average of the underlying asset's prices on major spot exchanges. The index price is continuously updated as the spot price of the underlying asset changes, reflecting the actual market value of the futures pair. MEXC selects the spot prices of the underlying asset from various major exchanges as the source of the futures index.

The purpose of setting the index price is to reduce the risk caused by price volatility and market manipulation, providing a more stable price reference.



## Calculation Method:
Index Price = (Weight Percent of Exchange A * Spot Price of the Underlying Asset on Exchange A + Weight Percent of Exchange B * Spot Price of the Underlying Asset on Exchange B + ... + Weight Percent of Exchange N * Spot Price of the Underlying Asset on Exchange N)

• Weighted Percent of Exchange i = Weight of Exchange i / Total Weight
• Total Weight = Weight of Exchange A + Weight of Exchange B + ... + Weight of Exchange N

MEXC will periodically update the index components and weights. If extreme market conditions or abnormal price deviations occur, MEXC will take additional protective measures, including but not limited to changing the index components and weights without prior notice.



## Please Note:
If the market data from a particular exchange is frequently slow to update or has deviating prices, the spot price data from that exchange will be excluded from the calculation. If the data quality from the excluded exchange recovers, it will be included in the calculation again.

If the spot price of a particular exchange deviates from the median of all exchanges by ±3%, MEXC will implement a price protection mechanism and exclude the spot price from that exchange (under extreme market conditions, the platform may adjust the median deviation coefficient for certain trading pairs or not be bound by this arrangement).



## 2. What is Fair Price?
The fair price is calculated based on the index price and the cost basis moving average.

To improve market stability and reduce unnecessary forced liquidations during abnormal market fluctuations, MEXC perpetual futures use a specially designed fair price marking system. Instead of using the last price, the system sets the mark price to the fair price. This helps prevent unnecessary deviations between the market price and the price index caused by market manipulation or lack of liquidity, thereby avoiding unnecessary forced liquidations.

On the MEXC futures trading page, you can view the [Fair Price] on the right side of the trading pair. Alternatively, you can set the K-line chart to display the [Fair Price] at the top of the chart.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240629235415060xc2PXL8arSvW9U.png]


## Calculation Method:
Fair Price = Median (Funding Rate Premium, Mid-Price Basis Fair Price, Last Price)

• Funding Rate Premium = Index Price * (1 + Latest Funding Rate * (Hours Until Next Funding Settlement / Funding Settlement Period in Hours))
• Mid-Price Basis Fair Price = Index Price + Moving Average of Basis (specified period) = Index Price + Moving Average [(Best Bid Price + Best Ask Price) / 2 - Index Price]
• Last Price is the most recent futures transaction price, updated in real-time.



## Please Note:
The fair price only affects the liquidation price and unrealized PNL, it does not affect realized PNL.

This means that when MEXCers' orders are executed, they may see positive or negative unrealized profit and loss immediately. This happens due to a slight deviation between the Fair Price and the Last Price. This is a normal phenomenon and does not mean that MEXCers have lost funds, but MEXCers must pay attention to the forced liquidation price to avoid being forced to liquidate prematurely.



## 3. What is Market Trade Price?
Market Trade price refers to the price at which futures pairs are instantly traded in the MEXC order book.

You can view this price by clicking on the [Market Trades] tab in the order book area on the MEXC futures trading page.


[IMAGE: https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240629235415160UAg3dF4s32VWmm.png]

Hover your mouse over [Last Price ▼], [Index Price ▼], or [Fair Price ▼] above the K-line chart, and a dropdown menu with three price options will appear. ## 1. Apakah Harga Indeks?
Harga indeks ialah purata berwajaran harga aset asas di bursa spot utama. Harga indeks dikemas kini secara berterusan apabila harga spot aset asas berubah, mencerminkan nilai pasaran sebenar pasangan niaga hadapan. MEXC memilih harga spot aset asas daripada pelbagai bursa utama sebagai sumber indeks niaga hadapan.

Tujuan menetapkan harga indeks adalah untuk mengurangkan risiko yang disebabkan oleh turun naik harga dan manipulasi pasaran, menyediakan rujukan harga yang lebih stabil.



## Kaedah Pengiraan:
Harga Indeks = (Peratus Berat Bursa A * Harga Spot Aset Asas di Bursa A + Peratus Berat Bursa B * Harga Spot Aset Asas di Bursa B + ... + Peratus Berat Bursa N * Harga Spot Aset Asas di Bursa N)

• Peratus Berat Bursa i = Berat Bursa i / Jumlah Berat
• Jumlah Berat = Berat Bursa A + Berat Bursa B + ... + Berat Bursa N

MEXC akan mengemas kini komponen dan berat indeks secara berkala. Sekiranya keadaan pasaran yang melampau atau penyelewengan harga yang luar biasa berlaku, MEXC akan mengambil langkah perlindungan tambahan, termasuk tetapi tidak terhad kepada menukar komponen dan berat indeks tanpa notis terlebih dahulu.



## Sila Ambil Perhatian:
Sekiranya data pasaran daripada bursa tertentu sering lambat dikemas kini atau mempunyai harga yang menyimpang, data harga spot daripada bursa tersebut akan dikecualikan daripada pengiraan. Sekiranya kualiti data daripada bursa yang dikecualikan pulih, ia akan dimasukkan semula ke dalam pengiraan.

Sekiranya harga spot bursa tertentu menyimpang daripada median semua bursa sebanyak ±3%, MEXC akan melaksanakan mekanisme perlindungan harga dan mengecualikan harga spot daripada bursa tersebut (dalam keadaan pasaran yang melampau, platform mungkin boleh melaraskan pekali sisihan median untuk pasangan dagangan tertentu atau tidak terikat dengan susunan ini).



## 2. Apakah Harga Adil?
Harga adil dikira berdasarkan harga indeks dan purata bergerak kos asas.

Untuk meningkatkan kestabilan pasaran dan mengurangkan likuidasi paksa yang tidak perlu semasa turun naik pasaran yang luar biasa, niaga hadapan kekal MEXC menggunakan sistem penandaan harga adil yang direka khas. Bukannya menggunakan harga terakhir, sistem menetapkan harga tanda kepada harga adil. Ini membantu mencegah penyelewengan yang tidak perlu antara harga pasaran dan indeks harga yang disebabkan oleh manipulasi pasaran atau kekurangan kecairan, dengan itu mengelakkan likuidasi paksa yang tidak perlu.

Di halaman dagangan niaga hadapan MEXC, anda boleh melihat [Harga Adil] di sebelah kanan pasangan dagangan. Sebagai alternatif, anda boleh menetapkan carta K-line untuk memaparkan [Harga Adil] di bahagian atas carta.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240629235415060xc2PXL8arSvW9U.png)


## Kaedah Pengiraan:
Harga Adil = Median (Premium Kadar Pendanaan, Harga Adil Asas Harga Tengah, Harga Terakhir)

• Premium Kadar Pendanaan = Harga Indeks * (1 + Kadar Pendanaan Terkini * (Jam Sehingga Penyelesaian Pendanaan Seterusnya / Tempoh Penyelesaian Pendanaan dalam Jam))
• Harga Adil Asas Harga Tengah = Harga Indeks + Purata Bergerak Asas (tempoh yang ditentukan) = Harga Indeks + Purata Bergerak [(Harga Tawaran Terbaik + Harga Minta Terbaik) / 2 - Harga Indeks]
• Harga Terakhir ialah harga transaksi niaga hadapan yang paling terkini, dikemas kini secara masa nyata.



## Sila Ambil Perhatian:
Harga adil hanya mempengaruhi harga likuidasi dan PNL yang belum direalisasi, ia tidak menjejaskan PNL yang telah direalisasi.

Ini bermakna apabila pesanan MEXCers dilaksanakan, mereka mungkin melihat keuntungan dan kerugian yang belum direalisasi yang positif atau negatif dengan serta-merta. Ini berlaku disebabkan oleh sedikit penyelewengan antara Harga Adil dan Harga Terakhir. Ini adalah fenomena biasa dan tidak bermakna bahawa MEXCers telah kehilangan dana, tetapi MEXCers mesti memberi perhatian kepada harga likuidasi paksa untuk mengelakkan daripada dipaksa untuk melikuidasi terlalu awal.



## 3. Apakah Harga Dagangan Pasaran?
Harga Dagangan Pasaran merujuk kepada harga di mana pasangan niaga hadapan didagangkan serta-merta dalam buku pesanan MEXC.

Anda boleh melihat harga ini dengan mengklik pada tab [Dagangan Pasaran] di kawasan buku pesanan di halaman dagangan niaga hadapan MEXC.


![Gambar](https://mexc-rainbown-activityimages.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/banner/F20240629235415160UAg3dF4s32VWmm.png)

4.1 Laman WebBuka halaman dagangan niaga hadapan di MEXC. Arahkan tetikus anda ke atas [Harga Terakhir ▼], [Harga Indeks ▼], atau [Harga Adil ▼] di atas carta K-line, dan menu lungsur dengan tiga pilihan harga akan muncul.
